title: qbz-191_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[QBZ-191]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], QBZ-191 appears as [[Qiongjiu (girls' frontline 2)|]].

A chivalrous Doll who makes for a very trustworthy teammate due to her down-to-earth and level-headed demeanor on the battlefield. She is good at handling all kinds of situations, but she finds it unbearable when she herself becomes someone to be protected. Off the battlefield, her aloofness is replaced by a generous and benevolent spirit that makes her an unexpectedly witty conversationalist. She is extremely popular among Dolls and humans alike, though she doesn't seem aware of her gifts.

Illustrated by [[Imoko (imonatsuki)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5175673

h4. Skins

* !post #6910967: [[QBZ-191 (Lone Pine Walker) (girls' frontline)|Lone Pine Walker]]

title: suomi_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Finnish [[Suomi KP/-31]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].  

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and wears a [[blue jacket]] as well as a [[white cape]], resembling a Finnish [[military uniform]] in the 1930s.

She has a strong resentment towards Russian origin T-dolls, whether they are Soviet-era or not, likely stemming from the Finnish-Soviet animosity during the Winter War. Would receive a [[Suomi (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. Appears in the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]] as [[suomi (girls' frontline 2)|herself]].

title: derek_chauvin
body:
Derek Michael Chauvin is an American former police officer who murdered [[George Floyd]], a 46-year-old African-American man, in Minneapolis, Minnesota. On May 25, 2020, Chauvin knelt on Floyd's neck for about nine minutes while Floyd was handcuffed and lying face down on the street, calling out "I can't breathe," during an arrest made with three other officers. Chauvin was dismissed by the Minneapolis Police Department on May 26 and arrested on May 29. The murder set off a series of protests in Minneapolis–Saint Paul, across the United States and around the world.

Chauvin was a member of the Minneapolis Police Department from 2001 to 2020. In his career, Chauvin had 18 complaints against him in his official record and was involved in three police shootings, one of which was fatal. He received two letters of reprimand for misconduct. He received two medals of valor and two commendation medals during his career.

In early 2021, Chauvin was put on trial for unintentional second-degree murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter of Floyd before a jury in the Minnesota Fourth Judicial District Court. On April 20, he was convicted on all of the charges. On June 25, he was sentenced to 22½ years in prison (with credit given for 199 days time served), with the possibility of supervised release after 15 years (two thirds of his sentence) contingent on factors such as good behavior. Requests to the Minnesota Supreme Court and Supreme Court of the United States for review were denied.

Chauvin pleaded guilty in late 2021 to federal charges of violating Floyd's civil rights by using unreasonable force and ignoring Floyd's serious medical needs. Simultaneously, Chauvin pleaded guilty to violating a 14-year-old boy's civil rights in 2017 by using unreasonable force. In mid-2022, Chauvin was sentenced to 21 years in prison for violating Floyd's civil rights. The federal and state sentences are to run concurrently. The Minnesota Department of Corrections lists Chauvin's anticipated release date on the state sentence as December 10, 2035. For the federal charges, Chauvin will likely be released from prison in the year 2038. Chauvin filed a motion in federal court in mid-November 2023 attempting to vacate his guilty plea.

After the conclusion of the criminal and civil rights cases, Chauvin was transferred in August 2022 from Oak Park Heights prison in Minnesota to FCI Tucson in Arizona, a medium-security federal facility, to serve his sentence. He was stabbed by another inmate at the federal facility on November 24, 2023.

title: patreon_username
body:
The rendering of a page on Patreon found somewhere on an image. The name of the page could be seen in a URL of the page, as just the name next to the [[patreon logo|logo]], or found in a message asking a user to visit the page so long as it's clearly discernible as a Patreon page. Commonly this is a name for the artist or one of their accounts but it does not have to be. If it is a verified name of the artist, tag [[artist name]] as well.

h4. See also

title: oerlikon_20mm_gun
body:
The Oerlikon 20mm [[autocannon]] was one of the most common [[anti-aircraft gun]]s of [[World War II]], used by both Allied and Axis forces on land, installed into aircraft, and mounted onto naval vessels. The latter is where the Oerlikon was most commonly seen, as Allied navies adopted the Oerlikon wholesale to replace smaller-caliber antiaircraft weapons such as the .50 caliber [[Browning M2]] in 1942. However, the rapid pace of wartime aircraft development outpaced the Oerlikon's ability to effectively destroy enemy aircraft, and the gun was withdrawn from service by the end of the 1940s.

It is most often seen in a single mount, though double and even quadruple mounts were developed and used. The Oerlikon can be easily identified visually by the large piston shroud around the barrel that facilitated its blowback operation. Shipboard mounts tended to have a large drum magazine out the top and a curved brace to fit into the operator's shoulders while firing, as well as a gun shield to protect the loaders.

h4. See also
* [[Bofors 40 mm gun]]

title: josephine_mutzenbacher
body: The [[loli]] protagonist of the erotic novel [[Josephine Mutzenbacher or The Story of a Viennese Whore as Told by Herself]]. While fifty-two at the time of her death, the narrative in the novel recounts events between when she was five years old and thirteen years old.
other_names: ヨゼフィーネ・ムッツェンバッヒェル

title: josephine_mutzenbacher_or_the_story_of_a_viennese_whore_as_told_by_herself
body:
[[Josephine Mutzenbacher]] or The Story of a Viennese Whore, as Told by Herself (German: Josefine Mutzenbacher oder Die Geschichte einer Wienerischen Dirne von ihr selbst erzählt) is an erotic novel first published anonymously in Vienna, Austria, in 1906. Its content is entirely pornographic and the book has been banned repeatedly.

The plot is framed as first-person narrative memoir by a soon-to-be-dead prostitute recounting her childhood. The book begins when she is five years old and ends when she at age thirteen begins her career as an unlicensed prostitute in order to support her unemployed father.

title: futaba_channel
body:
[b]Futaba Channel[/b] (ふたば(双葉)☆ちゃんねる [i]Futaba Channeru[/i]), translated as [b]Double Leaf Channel[/b] or [b]Two Leaf Channel[/b] and also abbreviated as [b]Futaba[/b] for short, also known as [b]2chan[/b], is a very popular Japanese internet imageboard dealing in [[otaku]] and underground culture.

[[4chan]] was based off of Futaba's imageboard system.

Not to be confused with [[2channel]], a separate text-based website.

title: storm_(x-men)
body:
Born as the Kenyan-American Ororo Monroe, Storm is a [[Marvel]] Comics mutant superheroine whose superpower is controlling the weather (especially flight and shooting thunderbolts). A Duelist character in [[Marvel Rivals]].

[[Halle Berry]] and Alexandra Shipp portrayed the character in live-action adaptations.

title: mrs._snake_(fate)
body:
(Currently) NPC character from [[Fate/Grand Order]], first debuting in the [i]Grow Up! My Little Dragon ~The Dreams Seen by Those with Scales~[/i] event on January 15/16, 2025 (JP). Her true identity is Mrs. Snake or the "Snake Wife". A character originating from a variation of the Tsuru no Ongaeshi folktale from which [[Miss Crane_(fate)|]] originates.

In the event, she initially goes by the alias of "Omi-san" until her True Name is revealed.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]] that's [[hair_over_one_eye|covering one eye]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], [[pale skin]] and [[large breasts]], and wears a [[sweater dress]]. Other features include both [[hoop_earrings|hoop]] and [[tassel earrings]], [[blue eyeshadow]] and [[blue_lips|blue]] [[lipstick]]

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Mrs. Snake":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Mrs._Snake

title: pacific_rim
body:
[i][b]Pacific Rim[/b][/i] is a 2013 American anime-influenced [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] monster film directed by [[Guillermo del Toro]], written by del Toro and Travis Beacham, and starring [[Charlie Hunnam]], [[Idris Elba]], [[Kikuchi Rinko]], Charlie Day, [[Robert Kazinsky]], Max Martini, and Ron Perlman. 

The film is set in the 2020s, when humanity is under attack by "[[kaiju|Kaijus]]", colossal [[monster]]s which have emerged from the Pacific Ocean. To combat the creatures, humanity unites to create the [[Jaeger (pacific rim)|]]s: gigantic humanoid [[mecha]], each controlled by two or more pilots whose minds are joined by a neural bridge.

A sequel called [[Pacific Rim: Uprising]] was released worldwide in March 2018. An animated series titled [[Pacific Rim: The Black]] was released in 2021.

According to Mexican director Guillermo del Toro, the film was heavily influenced by the old Toho [[tokusatsu]] monster films like [[Godzilla]] as well as classic [[super robot]] anime shows like [[Tetsujin 28-Gou]] and [[Mazinger Z]].

title: drivesuit_(pacific_rim)
body:
A fictional [[mecha pilot suit]] from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction series. It first appeared in the live action film from 2013.

The [b]drivesuit[/b] is a special type of armored [[bodysuit]] that protects and enables the Jaeger [[mecha]] [[pilot]]s to have a neural link with the machine's computer systems and their fellow copilots.

title: skindentation
body:
Portmanteau of "skin indentation".

When clothes are so [[tight clothes|tight]] they indent into the skin and make the surrounding flesh bulge outwards. For example, tight [[thighhighs]] that cause the thighs to bulge over the top.

See [[deep skin]] for when skindentation is caused by groping instead of clothing.

title: melanie_hue_carbine
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985.

[b]Melanie Hue Carbine[/b] is the cunning and ambitious chairman of [[Anaheim Electronics]] during [i]The Gryps War[/i]. 

A crafty and clever "war merchant" who sells [[mobile suit]]s to both sides of the conflict (the [[AEUG]] and the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]), he is known to be shy of the media.
other_names: メラニー・ヒュー・カーバイン

title: re-gz
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Char's Counterattack]] anime film from 1988.

[b]RGZ-91 Re-GZ[/b]

An attempt by [[Anaheim Electronics]] to cheapen and simplify the [[Zeta Plus]] [[mobile suit]] - resulting in the [b]Re[/b]fined [b]G[/b]undam [b]Z[/b]eta, a new MS deployed by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [i]Londo Bell[/i] fleet. 

Omitting the transformation mechanism in favor of a backpack that enabled a simulated [[Wave Rider]] Mode, it ultimately didn't perform as expected, and the data obtained from the two prototypes - one piloted by [[Amuro Ray]] and [[Chan Agi]] - helped to create the first mass production transformable MS of the Federation - the [[ReZEL]].

title: stalker_(helldivers)
body: Enemies from the [[Helldivers (series)|]] franchise. Stalkers are [[Terminid (helldivers)|Terminid/Bug]] specialized in hit-and-run tactics, often dishing out massive damage against an unsuspecting target. They can flee and cloak themselves with a near-invisible camouflage to their surrounding.

title: bile_titan
body: Enemies from [[Helldivers (series)|Helldivers 2]]. An enormous [[Terminid (helldivers)|]] that is said to be the final life cycle stage of a Bile Warrior. It vomits its lethal bile to its target or use is hulking claws to crush them.

title: charger_(helldivers)
body: Enemies from [[Helldivers (series)|Helldivers 2]]. They are large brutish [[Terminid (helldivers)|]]s capable of charging recklessly against their targets.

title: hive_guard_(helldivers)
body: A medium sized [[terminid_(helldivers)|Terminid]] enemy in the second [[Helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] game. They are a variant of the Warrior boasting a tough hide and specializes in guarding Terminid territory.

title: eagle_1_(helldivers)
body: Artist interpretation of the female pilot of [[Eagle_1_(helldivers)|Eagle-1]], the fire support gunship that makes bombing or attack runs when Stratagems are used in [[helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] franchise.  Portrayed as ''extremely'' trigger-happy, especially compared to the pilot of [[Pelican_1_(helldivers)|Pelican-1]].

title: pelican_1_(helldivers)
body: Artist interpretation of the pilot of the Pelican-1, the main extraction dropship used in [[helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] franchise.  Usually portrayed as calmer and less trigger-happy than the pilot of [[eagle_1_(helldivers)|Eagle-1]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[two side up]], long [[sidelocks]], [[ahoge]] and [[swept bangs]]. There is a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. Typically, she combines [[Nijigasaki School Uniform|school uniforms]] with a [[black shirt]] and a [[red jacket]] or [[red sweater vest|sweater vest]].

She is a member of [[r3birth_(love_live!)|R3BIRTH]].

title: yuki_setsuna
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Her real name is [[Nakagawa Nana]], with "Yuki Setsuna" being a stage name. She uses that name to hide the fact that she is Nijigasaki's Student Council President (until she is succeeded by [[Mifune Shioriko]] later in the story) and from her family. She's very fond of anime and gaming culture, but she's also very energetic and easily excitable.  

She has [[black eyes|black]] or [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and styled with [[one side up]] and worn with a [[triangle hair ornament]] in her school uniform.

She is a member of [[azuna (love live!)|A・ZU・NA]]. 

Voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]] (2017-2023) and [[Hayashi Coco]] (2023-present).

Hence in-game she is currently the only one to have a "unique" interaction with her Trainer depending on gender, with her being much comfortable and looking up to the female trainer while having a tsundere-like attitude to the male trainer.

She is also a closet otaku with a talent of shoujo manga which later her depicted with Agnes Digital.

title: oboro-maru_(live_a_live)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Twilight of Edo Japan: The Infiltrator chapter. A young shinobi of the Enma Clan, sent on an important mission to rescue a [[sakamoto ryouma (live a live)|prisoner]] from the clutches of [[Ode Iou]], for the sake of Japan's future.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after fighting him.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Hashizume Tomohisa in the 2022 remake.

title: cube_(live_a_live)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Distant Future: The Mechanical Heart chapter. A robot built as an autonomous support unit, he eventually comes to be seen as just as human as the crew.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after finding his battery and inserting it into him.
other_names: キューブ(ライブアライブ)

title: lei_kuugo
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and one of the protagonists of the Imperial China: The Successor chapter. One of the 3 possible successors, alongside [[Yun Jou]] and [[Hong Hakka]] to the Earthen Heart kung fu, representing the martial arts of the skill or spirit.

[spoilers] It is possible for her and one other disciple to die in the Imperial China chapter if either are not leveled up the most.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]She is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), she can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after fighting her.[/spoilers]

She is voiced by [[Ueda Reina]] in the 2022 remake.

title: hong_hakka
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and one of the protagonists of the Imperial China: The Successor chapter. One of the 3 possible successors, alongside [[Lei Kuugo]] and [[Yun Jou]] to the Earthen Heart kung fu, representing the martial arts of the body.

[spoilers]It is possible for him and one other disciple to die in the Imperial China chapter if either are not leveled up the most.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after a giving him food.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Mizushima Yuu in the 2022 remake.

title: master_shinzanken
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and the main protagonist of the Imperial China: The Successor chapter. An old, dying man looking for a successor to keep his Earthen Heart kung fu alive.

[spoilers]At the end of the Imperial China chapter, he dies after the successor's battle with [[odi wang lee|Ou Di Wan Lee]]. Having taught everything he knows to his successor, he succeeds in his final goal.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Ishimaru Hiroya in the 2022 remake.

title: yun_jou
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and one of the protagonists of the Imperial China: The Successor chapter. One of the 3 possible successors, alongside [[Lei Kuugo]] and [[Hong Hakka]] to the Earthen Heart kung fu, representing the martial arts of the heart or mind.

[spoilers]It is possible for him and one other disciple to die in the Imperial China chapter if either are not leveled up the most.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after a brief conversation.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Shimono Hiro]] in the 2022 remake.

title: pogo_(live_a_live)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Prehistory: The First chapter. A young and excitable caveman who learns much more of the world he lives in.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party. Can be recruited without fighting if [[Lei Kuugo]] is the selected protagonist.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Ogata Megumi]] in the 2022 remake.

title: takahara_masaru
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Present Day: The Strongest chapter. A wrestler who can learn moves from his rivals. Infamous for being like [[Aqua (Konosuba)|a certain goddess]] and having his Int stat never go up.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party. Can be recruited without fighting if either [[sundown kid|The Sundown Kid]] or [[cube (live a live)|Cube]] is the selected protagonist.[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Seki Tomokazu]] in the remake.

title: tadokoro_akira
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of The Near Future: The Outsider chapter. A psychic teenage punk who sells taiyaki and also happens to end up driving a massive robot.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Akabane Kenji]] and [[Mikami Shiori]] in the 2022 remake.

title: sundown_kid
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of The Wild West: The Wanderer chapter. A cowboy who aimlessly wanders the American frontier, he is given a chance for redemption after coming across a victimized community.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Ootsuka Akio]] in the 2022 remake.

title: demon_king_odio
body:
Main antagonist of [[Live A Live]]. Lord of all Demons and the equivalent of a hateful deity, with boundless hate that traverses from the ancient times to the distant future.

[spoilers]At the end of the Middle Ages chapter, it is revealed that [[Oersted]] renounced his former ties and titles from Lucrece and took on the name "Odio", becoming the next Lord of Dark after losing the faith of those he loved and a lack of those to believe in him. One of the playable characters for the Final Chapter if Oersted is chosen as the protagonist.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] in the 2022 remake.

body:

[[Ukiyo Ace]] is a mysterious, seemingly ageless man with a confident personality and the skills to back it up. Calling himself "the Star of the Stars of the Stars", he is a constant favorite to win the Desire Grand Prix, having done so many times in a row, yet somehow not satisfying his ultimate wishes.

body:
The final form of [[Kamen Rider Tycoon]], clad in [[black armor]] and a [[cape]] alongside a [[katana]] inside a [[sheath]].

After [spoiler]the death of his sister, caused by her transformation into a Jyamato,[/spoiler] the once idealistic and eager [[Sakurai Keiwa]] is consumed by unyielding rage, and pressures [[tsumuri (Kamen rider geats)|Tsumuri]] into creating the BujinSword Buckle so that he may wield its overwhelming power to exact merciless vengeance.

title: kamen_rider_double
body:
Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider W]], twentieth show of the Kamen Rider series and eleventh of the Heisei generation.

Self-proclaimed "hard-boiled" private eye [[Hidari Shoutarou]] and his enigmatic assistant [[philip_(kamen_rider)|Philip]] combat Dopants, humans turned into monsters via [[Gaia Memory|Gaia Memories]] to wreak havoc in the city of Fuuto, using their "true" Gaia Memories and the Double Driver to merge into Double.

Double has two halves split down the middle, with Shotaro forming the body and left half, and Philip the mind and right half. Each half has 3 forms, making for 9 combinations, of which the most prominent is CycloneJoker. Other forms include FangJoker (where Philip becomes the body and Shotaro being the mind) and CycloneJoker Xtreme (with both men merged as one).

title: kamen_rider_skull
body:
The Rider form assumed by Detective [[Narumi Sokichi]] in [[Kamen Rider W]].

Kamen Rider Skull's head resembles a human skull wearing a white fedora and a muffler around his neck.

title: kamen_rider_diend
body: Kamen Rider Diend is the secondary Rider of [[kamen_rider_dcd|Kamen Rider Decade]]. Diend has a cyan-and-black color scheme and is patterned after a [i]zicrona caerulea[/i], a cerulean species of shield bugs (Decade is patterned after the pink [i]graphosoma lineatum[/i]), as well as barcodes.

title: kamen_rider_kuuga_(ultimate_form)
body:
[[Kamen Rider Kuuga]]'s final form. In this form, he gains a black-colored body with [[spikes]] on the shoulders, forearms and lower part of the legs, a headpiece with [[multiple horns|five horns]], a mouthpiece with sharp, fanged design, and the Amadam stone in the [[rider belt|Arcle]] is now black-colored. The eyes has differing colors as a sign if Kuuga is in full control of his powers in this form or not: [[red eyes|Red]] (similar to Mighty Form) for the former, and [[black eyes|black]] for the latter. 

This form is also the combination of all of Kuuga's previous forms' power without the weaknesses present on them (such as Pegasus Form's sensory overload) and his parameters are much higher, becoming as powerful as [[N-Daguva-Zeba]]. He also has the ability to use any of his previous forms' weapons and possess some abilities that Daguva also uses, such as [[pyrokinesis]], the ability to see human forms of every Gurongi, and the ability to break defenses no matter how strong they are and draw blood in his attacks. It is said that his finishing move, the [i][[rider kick|Ultimate Kick]][/i], can destroy the world if used at full power.

However, using this form puts Kuuga at risk of losing control and becoming a monster bent on destruction like Daguva. It can only be fully controlled if he possess a pure heart. 

Being the first Final Form of the Heisei-era Kamen Riders and beyond, succeeding Riders' Final Forms are also nicknamed "Ultimate Form/s" in its honor.
other_names: アルティメットフォーム

title: rope_braid
body: A distinctive style of [[braid]] that twists the hair when braiding, resembling a rope. "Rope braid" usually refers to a two strand twist, where two strands of hair are twisted together. However, a similar look can also be achieved using other numbers of strands. For example, a three strand twist is a braid where three strands of hair are twisted together. Occasionally a single strand of twisted hair can also result in a similar look. These are not always distinguishable by eye. For tagging purposes, all of them are considered rope braid.

[[Spider-Man]] and [[Mary Jane Watson]]'s kiss in the rain from [[Spider-Man 1 (2002)|]] is arguably one of the most recognizable and parodied examples of this type of kiss.

Don't use this tag for generic [[rotational symmetry]].

title: tumbleweed
body: A tumbleweed is typically depicted as a spherical yellow or brown ball, often featured as a trope in [[cowboy Western]] media, where it is usually seen drifting about in the [[desert]] or any other desolate area.

title: bramblin
body:
[[Pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #946 in the National Pokédex, and a Grass/Ghost type.

A Pokémon based off a [[tumbleweed]], with a rounded yellow body. Its diamond-shaped eyes seem detached from its body; it has [[black sclera]] and [[red eyes]] that are [[slit pupils|slit-shaped]].

It evolves into [[Brambleghast]].

title: kemomimi-chan_(naga_u)
body:
[[Naga U]]'s [[original]] character.

She is a girl with [[fox ears]] and [[fox_tail|tail]], typically drawn with [[chibi|compact proportions]]. Her hands are always hidden by her long sleeves. Whenever her ears would be covered, they somehow poke through even the hardest of materials. 

Her favorite food seems to be [[boned meat]]. 

She tends to be drawn as whatever the artist wants and thus, has many forms. Her alternate forms include:

* [[nezumimi-chan_(naga_u)|Nezumimi-chan]]: A [[mouse girl]] version of Kemomimi-chan.
* [[kemomimi-chan_(fish)_(naga_u)|Kemomimi-chan Fish]]: Kemomimi-chan [[animalization|as a]] [[fish]]. A common occurence. (post #3302806)
* Kemomimi-chan? (question mark included): A [[raccoon_girl|tanuki girl]] version of Kemomimi-chan. (post #3316944)
* Another Kemomimi-chan and Black Kemomimi-chan: Palette swaps of Kemomimi-chan. Another has red hair, blue eyes, a blue collar and the red her outfit has been replaced by more green. Black has darker skin, dark green hair, red eyes and a black and white outfit. They also wear conventional thighhighs and shoes.
* "-chan": Kemomimi-chan [[no_animal_ears|without the Kemomimi]]. (post #3323503)
* Kemomimi-san: Kemomimi-chan when she isn't drawn as a chibi. Can also be named Kemomimi-chan-san. (post #4519573)
* [[Year of the Rabbit]] Kemomimi-chan: A [[rabbit girl]] verson of Kemomimi-chan with [[white hair]]. Wears a white and red version of Kemomimi-chan's usual outfit as well as [[twin braids]]. (post #6131672)


h4. Appearance

* !post #2911489: Default
* !post #2795027: Summer outfit
* !post #5038900: Winter outfit

title: froslass
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #478 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Ice/Ghost Pokémon.

Froslass is a humanoid Pokémon with a hollow torso that resembles a kimono. It wears a red band around its waist, reminiscent of an obi. Its body lacks feet and it floats in the air like its alternate-evolution counterpart, [[Glalie]]. It has [[yellow sclera]] and light [[blue eyes]].

It evolves from female [[Snorunt]].

Its shiny form colors its red 'sash' into a pink sash.

h4. Official art

Prior Pokémon: [[Dusknoir]]

title: planetarium
body:
A [b]planetarium[/b] (plural [b]planetaria[/b] or [i][[ranguage|planetariums]][/i]) is a [[theater]] built primarily for presenting educational and entertaining shows about [[astronomy]] and the [[night sky]], or for training in celestial navigation. A dominant feature of most planetaria is the large [[dome]]-shaped projection screen onto which scenes of [[star_(sky)|stars]], [[planet|planets]] and other celestial objects can be made to appear and move realistically to simulate the complex "motions of the heavens".

Can also be used to describe an object that projects star-like lights on a surface (such as the ceiling). 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Planetarium":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planetarium

title: star_of_lakshmi
body:
The [b]Star of Lakshmi[/b] is a complex {8/2} [[star (symbol)|]] figure (i.e. two squares with the same centre at 45° angles), and figures in Hinduism, where it represents Ashtalakshmi, the eight forms, or 'kinds of wealth', of the goddess [[Lakshmi]].

* !asset #20083286

h4. See also

* [[Octagram]], a type of which the star of Lakshmi is
* [[Hexagram]], typically formed of two triangles similarly to how the star of Lakshmi is of two squares
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Star of Lakshmi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_of_Lakshmi]

body:
A character introduced in [[Guilty Gear Xrd]], later becoming playable. Claims to be [[Ramlethal Valentine]]'s sister.

Elphelt Valentine is a big fan of nature and absolutely adores all kinds of animals. She is also a sweetheart and empathetic, and cannot stand to see others feeling lonely. Elphelt is also optimistic to a fault and firmly believes that anything can be overcome if one simply takes action.

She is passionate about appearing as feminine as possible as well as willing herself to become the woman she wants to be, but her efforts often end up in vain. Elphelt is a hopeless romantic whose fantasies often cloud her judgment, evident by her tendency to ask anyone who is friendly with her to "marry" her. Her weapons of choice are rifles, shotguns, and other various firearms and explosives.

In Xrd, she wears a [[bride]]-like getup donned with clovers and spikes that exposes her [[large breasts]]. In Strive, she wears a punk rock-like getup.
other_names: エルフェルト=ヴァレンタイン

title: rika_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Rika[/b], known as [b]Chili[/b] (チリ) in Japan, is a member of Elite Four of the Paldea region in [[Pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]. She also serves as the receptionist for the Pokémon League, interviewing the player during the first part of the Champion Assessment. She specializes in Ground-type Pokémon, her ace being [[Clodsire]].

She has a laidback and easygoing personality. In the original Japanese she speaks in the [[kansaiben|Kansai dialect]], though she will temporarily drop it when conducting the interview. She refers to the player as "kiddo" and has a distinct "nahaha" laugh.

Owing to her Japanese name, she is popularly represented by the 🌶️ (chili pepper) emoji among Japanese fanartists.

h4. Official art

* !post #7368822: [[Rika (pokemon)|Default]]

title: gustavo_fring
body:
The main antagonist of [i][[Breaking Bad]][/i], and a major character from its prequel [i][[Better Call Saul]][/i]. 

Portrayed by [[Giancarlo Esposito]].

Gustavo "Gus" Fring, also referred to as the Chicken Man and the Chilean, is a Chilean-American restaurant entrepreneur that uses his stores as a front for the drug trade. He is the proprietor of [[Los Pollos Hermanos]], a highly successful fried chicken restaurant chain. Gus is also a public booster for the Drug Enforcement Administration office in Albuquerque, New Mexico, as well as a member of the hospital board. Despite outward appearances, Gus is a major drug kingpin initially affiliated with the Cartel, who uses his restaurants as a front for methamphetamine distribution throughout the American southwest, before later fronting his own drug empire. Like Walter White, Gus is a criminal who "hides in plain sight," using his anti-drug philanthropy to conceal his true nature.

Four short films have been released, along with two feature films:

title: walter_white_screaming_in_car_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a scene in [[Breaking Bad]]. The original scene involves [[Walter White]] yelling at his brother-in-law [[Hank Schrader]] to warn him about the men that were sent to kill him.

Parodies of this scene first originated from [[4chan]] post parodying a scene in [[Breaking Bad]] where Walter White yells from a car window at Hank to get sweet and sour sauce, not barbeque.  It later spawning a meme format in which Walt tries to warn Hank of various things.

title: pillowdear
body:
An [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] who loves to make ASMR videos and stream.

Originally, she had debuted as a cupid here to spread love but later rebranded towards being a dream entity that enjoys helping people sleep. It's important to note that all costumes were designed and drawn by herself.

She still follows a cupid motif featuring [[head wings]] that are [[feathered wings|feathered]], [[pink eyes]] with [[heart-shaped pupils]], and a heart-shaped [[birthmark]] on her left thigh. Her hair is [[very long hair|very long]], reaching down to her feet and typically styled in [[twin braids]]. Her [[two-tone]] hair is pink on the exterior and white on the interior.

title: mesugaki
body:
Literally, "bitch brat". A young girl who acts sassy and provocative towards adults in a sexually charged manner. Often qualifies for [[loli]]. The masculine equivalent is called "[[osugaki]]".

Typical attributes include [[smug]] or [[naughty_face|naughty]] expressions, a mocking [[laughing|laugh]], a single [[fang]] / [[skin fang]], [[twintails]], [[short shorts]], [[miniskirt]]s/[[microskirt]]s, exposed [[midriff]], calling people "[[zako (phrase)|]]", etc. May be an [[oppai loli]].

Not to be confused with erogaki ("erotic brat") who is sexually forward or seductive without being sassy, or kusogaki ("shitty brat") who is sassy without a sexual undertone.

The present meaning seems to date back to August 2018, after the announcement of [[Grim Aloe]] being added to [[Bombergirl]]. For more details, see comment #2388484.

* [[zako (phrase)|]]

title: kepi
body:
A kind of [[hat]] that has a [[flat cap|flat]] top and cylindrical in shape, with a visor. This hat is mainly associated with the French forces, with its use going back to the 1850s. Many countries used it in the late 19th to early 20th centuries (including France, Japan, Brazil, Austria-Hungary, Romania, and Italy). Philippe Petain and Charles de Gaulle wore one in their official portraits during WWII.

title: shako_cap
body:
A tall, cylindrical [[military hat]], usually with a visor, sometimes tapered at the top. It is usually adorned with some kind of ornamental plate or badge on the front, and often has a [[feathers|feather]], [[plume]], or [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pompom]] attached at the top. This can also be used when characters are in a [[marching band]] and wearing this cap.

Take care not to confuse for a [[top hat]].

title: ribbon
body:
A ribbon is a thin band of flexible material, typically cloth but also plastic or sometimes metal, used primarily for binding and tying.  Often seen used in elaborate clothing and hair, and generally longer than it is wide.

A ribbon may be tied into any sort of knot, often a [[bow]], but should not be tagged as both.

[b]Example[/b]
post #844003: On top of her hair is some [[ribbon]], but the ribbon tying the hair tails together is a [[bow]].

title: sirius_symboli_(umamusume)
body:
A prideful [[Umamusume]] character with a motto of "Sirius the one brightest star". Her desire is to dominate even global competition. She's brash and foul-mouthed, but how she's got real skills to back up her immense confidence endows her with a charisma of her own. Furthermore, she would never lie thanks to her dislike of dishonesty and underhanded means. Hence, she's naturally charming. She calls her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]] Puppy.

title: dead_by_daylight
body:
From "the Steam page for the game":[https://store.steampowered.com/app/381210/Dead_by_Daylight/]:

"Dead by Daylight is an asymmetrical multiplayer (4vs1) [[horror (theme)|]] game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught, tortured and killed.

Survivors play in third-person and have the advantage of better situational awareness. The Killer plays in first-person and is more focused on their prey.

The Survivors' goal in each encounter is to escape the Killing Ground without getting caught by the Killer - something that sounds easier than it is, especially when the environment changes every time you play."

A dating sim spinoff titled [[Hooked on You]] was later released on August 2022.

"Official website":[http://www.deadbydaylight.com]

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2017)
body:
The 2017 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] version of [[Hatsune Miku]]. This year was the 10th anniversary of Hatsune Miku.

She was illustrated by [[iXima]]. She has circular, winged [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], a [[white shirt]] with white [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and holds a winged [[microphone wand]].

Her theme song is [[Suna no Wakusei (vocaloid)|]] by [[yonezu kenshi|Hachi]]. As such, she is often paired with the version of Miku portrayed in the song's PV.

body:

[[Horse girl]] with [[brown eyes|brownish]] [[orange eyes|orange]] [[+_+|star-crossed]] eyes. Her [[black hair]] is done up in massive [[twintails]] with saddle-looking leather covers on them and slightly [[drill sidelocks|drill-shaped sidelocks]]. She also wears a vaguely flower-shaped cloth [[ear ornament]] on [b]her right ear.[/b]

Marvel is easily excitable and regularly peppers her speech with the word "marvelous" as an allusion to her name.

body:
The 2018 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] version of [[Hatsune Miku]]. Her fan-nickname is "Furikake-chan".

She was illustrated by [[mika pikazo]] and has a vivid neon color palette. She wears a white [[sleeveless shirt]], aqua [[hoop skirt]], black [[detached sleeves]] and [[thighhighs]], all of which are adorned with [[bowtie|bowties]]. She has [[headphones]] around her wrists and holds a [[megaphone]] stand to which balloons are attached. The balloons have the numbers [[39]] and 01 printed on them.

Her theme song is [[Greenlights Serenade (vocaloid)|]] by Omoi.

body:
A character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. This tomboyish [[horse girl]] has resolute faith to her skills as a runner, especially as a sprinter.

Aside from being a filly/left-ear, Believe stands out amongst her friends and rivals in the "Sprinter trio" simply by being down to earth compared to them, being the straight woman to [[Durandal (umamusume)|]]'s chivalry antics and [[Calstone Light O (umamusume)|]]'s single-track mind.

body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Public Morals Committee Chairwoman (AKA Head Prefect, AKA [i]Fuuki Iinchou[/i]) of Tracen Academy.

Bamboo Memory is often depicted carrying around her 'namesake' [[shinai|bamboo blade]] (i.e. shinai). This shinai is effectively her badge of office, lending her a certain air of authority.

Ironically, despite being the head of the student disciplinary committee, Bamboo speaks in a rough 'accent' very [i]reminiscent[/i] of Japanese (male) delinquents.

title: calstone_light_o_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. A sprinter horse girl that pursues the path of "The Fastest". She is a horse girl whose calm and collected exterior belies her straightforward personality, her love for [[cat]]s, as well as her obsessions with straight lines.

She is notable as the first character based on a horse descended from Matchem's sire-line. This means that [[Godolphin Barb (umamusume)|AI Godolphin Barb]] finally has a direct descendant to cheer for, and hence why she repeatedly made appearances in her campaign.

The real Calstone Light O is also notable for holding the Japanese record for 1000m (≈5 furlongs in US/UK terms) on Turf (53.7 seconds during the 2002 Ibis Summer Dash, in Niigata), which is the reason for the Umamusume version's obsession about becoming "the fastest".

As the Ibis Summer Dash is one of very few straight races in Japan, she is also obsessed with going straight and straight lines in general, often to the point of spurning curves or anything that curves.

h4. Appearance

body:

Personality-wise, she has very distinct "on" and "off" modes according to [[Rhein Kraft (umamusume)|her roommate]], switching from stoic and serious at work to a complete sweetheart at rest. This disparity is considered a gap moe.

body:
"It's super effective!" is a catchphrase stemming from the [[Pokemon]] video game series. During gameplay, moves used by a pokemon (depending on the type of the move and the target pokemon's type) may result in additional damage which prompts the message "It's super effective!".

title: fly_me_to_the_moon
body:
[b]Fly Me to the Moon[/b], originally called [i]In Other Words[/i], is a 1954 Jazz song written by Bart Howard. While the song was first recorded by Kaye Ballard, it has been performed by many others, with its most famous rendition being the one sung by [[Frank Sinatra]] in 1964.

Notable to anime fans for being the ending song of [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], performed by various artists, including some of the voice actors.

title: kamiha_magica_idol_costume
body:
A costume belonging to the fictional [[idol]] group Kamiha☆Magica in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]], first introduced in its gag comic, Magia Report (pool #12770). See post #3853578 for designs.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[center frills|center]] [[frilled shirt|frills]], a [[collared shirt|collar]] and [[short sleeves]] ([[tied sleeves|tied]] and [[puffy short sleeves|puffy]] for most members, though Rena wears [[pleated sleeves|pleated]] ones instead), a [[neck ribbon]], a [[gingham]] [[underbust]] [[corset]] with a [[yellow flower|yellow]] [[flower symbol]] (or rather a blue [[star (symbol)|]] in Kuroe's case), a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[gingham skirt|gingham]] [[miniskirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]] and a [[back bow]], [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], white legwear of sorts (see below for exact types for each member) and [[strappy heels|heeled]] [[mary janes]] with [[footwear bow|bows]]. The color of the outfit depends on the member. 

h4. Notable members:
* [[Ayano Rika]] (red theme, [[kneehighs]])
* [[Kuroe (madoka magica)|]] (purple theme, [[kneehighs]]. Also substitutes the yellow flower for a blue [[star (symbol)|]])
* [[Minami Rena]] (blue theme, [[thighhighs]]. Also substitutes the puffy short sleeves for [[pleated sleeves]])
* [[Natsume Kako]] (green theme, [[frilled socks]])
* [[Tamaki Iroha]] (pink theme, [[white thighhighs|thighhighs]])
* [[Tomoe Mami]] (yellow theme, [[white thighhighs|thighhighs]])

title: bishie_sparkle
body:
In anime, attractive men and women walk around in a cloud of sparkles. Visually this translates to either an aura or background of [[sparkle]]s, [[heart]]s, [[flower]]s, [[flower symbol]]s, [[bokeh]] or what's known as "bishoujo or love bubbles":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveBubbles]. 
Usually includes a bright pastel colored background as well. Though it is not as visible in [[greyscale]] [[comic]]s. 

Use this tag when two or more of the above components are used together, creating a dreamlike theme.

Do not confuse with simpler background tags like [[heart background|heart]] and [[sparkle background]], or tags like [[sparkling aura| sparkling]], [[loving aura|loving]], and [[happy aura]] where it is only one component around a specific subject. 

* !post #7376503
* !post #7766937

h4.External links
* "TV tropes: Bishie sparkle":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BishieSparkle]

title: cherry_blossoms
body:
Small flowers of any of several trees of the genus Prunus, especially the Japanese Cherry ([i]Prunus serrulata[/i], the suffix a Latin rendering of [i]sakura[/i]). Usually seen falling or scattered as [[petals]].

Cherry blossoms, especially the [[pink flower|pink]] ones of the [i]Prunus serrulata[/i], are a significant visual motif in Japanese culture; as their period of flowering that lasts little more than a week during the spring is thought to symbolically convey an awareness of the brilliant, yet impermanent nature of life. The term [i]mono no aware[/i] (物の哀れ, literally 'the pathos of things') was coined by 18th century scholar Motoori Norinaga to describe this concept as a theme found in classical Japanese literature, and associated it with the cherry blossom motif. 

The white-colored autumn and winter blossoms (冬桜, [i]fuyuzakura[/i]) of the higan cherry tree ([i]Prunus subhirtella autumnalis[/i]) are a notable variant, coming into bloom during those seasons. 

In anime and manga, besides straightforward symbolization of youth and verve, the [[flower symbol|symbol]] may be used to denote gentle and/or affectionate characters; though this usage can sometimes be ironic. 

In [[Touken Ranbu]], cherry blossoms indicate that a character has a [[gameplay mechanics|buff]].

[[Cherry tree]]s in anime art are almost always drawn in bloom, but the actual cherries don't grow until the blossoms are long gone. For images of cherry trees bearing fruit, search for {{cherry fruit_tree}}.

Distinguished from [[plum blossoms]] in that cherry petals have slits at the ends of the petals. Plum petal ends on the other hand are round ("see reference":/media_assets/7899985).

h4. See also

* [[Cherry blossom print]]
* [[Hanami]]
* [[Pink theme]]
* [[Sakuramon]]

* [[Mxy-7 ohka]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cherry blossom":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cherry_blossom
* "What is the Difference Between Plum and Cherry Blossom?":https://livejapan.com/en/article-a0004908/

title: originium_(arknights)
body:
A black [[crystal]]line mineral that manifested as a result of the Catastrophes that ravaged the world of [[Arknights]]. It is useful as a power source, among other things, but overexposure causes "oripathy", which is the source of the [[oripathy lesion (arknights)|]]s seen on some characters, and may be fatal if exposed for a long period of time. Commonly depicted as black crystals.

In game, a special form of originium called [[originite prime (arknights)|]] is used as the premium currency for buying skins and pulling characters from the gacha system.

It is based on the tiberium, a (usually) green crystal from [i][[Command & Conquer]][/i] series, of which the originium shared several characteristic with.

h4. External links

* "Arknights Wiki: Originium":[https://arknights.wiki.gg/Originium]

title: ags-30
body:
The [b]AGS-30[/b] [i]Atlant[/i] is a Russian-designed automatic [[grenade launcher]]. Introduced in 1995, currently in production in the Russian Federation and in service with the [[russian ground forces|Russian]] [[military|armed forces]].

Designed as the improvement of "AGS-17":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AGS-17], the AGS-30 provides better mobility, longer range and better accuracy during firing. Significantly lighter than its previous version, the AGS-30 weighs 30 kg loaded, meaning it can be carried by one person. Using a specially designed GPD-30 [[ammunition|grenade]] (30×29mm), the AGS-30 can engage targets at 2100m.

It is usually mounted on a [[tripod]] or a [[turret]], or used as part of a remotely controlled [[weapon]] system, mounted on various [[military vehicle|combat vehicles]].

h4. See also

* [[Mk19 grenade launcher]] (the US "counterpart")
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Rosoboronexport":[http://roe.ru/esp/catalog/fondos-especiales/spetsgranatomety-y-municiones/ags-30/]
* "Wikipedia: AGS-30":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AGS-30]

title: a-545
body:
The [b]A-545[/b] (Автомат-545) is a successor line of sorts to the [[AEK-971]] and [[AEK-973]] assault rifle lines which saw limited service with [[Russian ground forces|Russian forces]]. It has a variant chambered for 7.62×39mm called the [b]A-762[/b].

Similar to the AEK-971 and 973, the A-545 controls and layout are heavily based on a normal [[ kalashnikov rifle |AK's]]. However, the A-545 features the BARS system (Balanced Automatic Recoil System), which shifts the mass toward the muzzle as the bolt and bolt carrier are recoiling rearward by way of a counterweight, negating the impulse of the gas piston and bolt carrier which results in more controllable automatic fire. The A-545 and A-762 come with one [[Picatinny Rail]] that runs along the top of the receiver. 

h4. See also
* [[a-545 (girls' frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: j-12_(call_of_duty)
body:
J-12 is a supporting antagonist in [[Call of Duty]]: [[Modern Warfare (2019)]], a [[russian ground forces|Russian]] [[soldier]] under the command of Roman Barkov in 1999 and part of J Group.

h4. Appearance
J-12 is a heavily [[muscular male|muscular]], 193 cm tall man.
[[1boy|He]] is portrayed wearing a [[gas mask]], [[sleeveless]] [[blue shirt|blue]]-[[white shirt|white]] [[telnyashka]], [[load_bearing_equipment]], [[ammunition pouch]], [[brown pants|khaki]] brown military [[cargo pants]]. His weapon is a [[Kalashnikov rifle]] with an [[optical sight]].

Call of Duty Wikia "page":[https://callofduty.fandom.com/wiki/J-12]

title: 9m133_kornet
body:
The 9M133 Kornet (Russian: Корнет; "Cornet", NATO reporting name AT-14 Spriggan) is a [[Russian ground forces|Russian]] man-portable [[anti-tank missile|anti-tank guided missile]] (ATGM) intended for use against [[tank|main battle tanks]]. The 9M133 missile together with its 9P163-1 tripod launcher and 1PN79-1 thermal sight (part of the 1P45-1 guidance device), form the 9K135 missile system, which can be carried and operated by a two-person infantry crew. 

In addition to an infantry portable version, the 9K133 system has been integrated into a variety of other vehicles and weapons systems as either an upgrade package or a new weapon system. The Kornet has been widely exported and is produced under license in several countries. It was first used in combat in 2003 and has since been used in many conflicts.

title: mila_(miside)
body:
Mila is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

She has the same [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] as other Mitas, but the red top has become a [[cardigan]], under which she wears a white dress shirt with a [[blue necktie]]. She wears [[glasses]], and has her [[short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with a red [[claw hair clip]].

Of all Mitas not damaged or deranged, Mila is the most divergent in terms of personality. She's a [[tsundere]], with some qualities of a nerd/[[otaku]] and of a [[chuunibyou|chuuni]] as well. She seeks to be as distinct from other Mitas as possible, and distances herself from their affairs.

Her version of the house contains a very likely [[Koseki Bijou]] easter egg, involving a short [[katana]] and a miniature [[moai]] statue.

title: creepy_mita_(miside)
body:
Creepy Mita, also known as Ugly Mita, is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

Unlike other Mitas, she wears a [[white shirt]] and [[white skirt|a matching skirt]], and also goes [[barefoot]].

Her distinctive features are her [[pale skin]], [[bloodshot eyes]] and [[messy hair]]. She can also [[long neck|stretch her neck]] to follow the player and spawn glitches.

title: tiny_mita_(miside)
body:
Tiny Mita, also known as Broken Mita, is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

A unique Mita, Tiny Mita is a [[child]], wearing a [[red dress]], a [[blue choker]], and a [[large bow|large]], [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]]. She has dark, almost black eyes and goes around [[barefoot]].

She is heavily disfigured, with bloodied, [[skin-covered_horns|horn-like]] growths on the left side of her face, an [[amputee|amputated]] left arm, and scars all over her body: on her [[scar_on_arm|arms]], [[scar_on_leg|legs]], [[scar_on_chest|chest]], and [[scar_on_face|face]], including a scar across her [[scar_across_eye|eye]]. The cause of her disfigurement is revealed to be [spoiler]Crazy Mita, who, jealous of Tiny Mita's cute appearance, killed Tiny Mita so many times that her ability to regenerate stopped working and she was left permanently damaged, both mentally and physically.[/spoiler]

title: sleepy_mita_(miside)
body:
Sleepy Mita is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

Like most other Mitas, Sleepy Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]].

Her unique characteristics that distinguish her from other Mitas include her [[red pajamas|red]], [[vertical-striped pajamas]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[shirt]] and [[shorts]], a [[sleep mask]], and a [[blue choker]], along with her [[medium hair|medium length]], [[wavy hair|wavy]], sometimes [[messy hair]].

Often depicted [[sleeping]] or [[sleepy]], with visible [[zzz]]'s.

title: kind_mita_(miside)
body:
Kind Mita is one of the main characters of [[MiSide]].

Like most other [[Mita_(miside)|]]s, Kind Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]].

Her clothing is identical to default Mitas - she wears [[red thighhighs]], a [[blue_skirt|blue]], [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] skirt, a [[red sweater]], a [[red choker]] and a red [[hairclip]].

Her only distinctive feature is her long, [[straight hair]].

title: mikey_simon
body:
Michael Alexander "Mikey" Simon is the titular protagonist of [[Kappa Mikey]]. He is a 19-year-old American from Cleveland, Ohio and is the only American main character on LilyMu.

The main joke of the series is that while Mikey is drawn in a typical American cartoon form (thicker outlines, round eyes, large head, only eight fingers), his Japanese co-stars are drawn in a traditional anime style (thinner outlines, more detail, large eyes and mouth, all 10 fingers; use of various face-faults).

title: kappa_mikey
body:
Kappa Mikey is an American animated comedy television series created by Larry Schwarz for [[Nickelodeon|Nicktoons]] Network. Despite airing on the channel, it was not a Nicktoon, being produced by Schwarz's production company Animation Collective. The series ran from February 25, 2006, to September 20, 2008, with repeats until November 29, 2010, across two seasons.52 22-minute episodes were produced.
Intended as a parody of Japanese anime, the series follows a young American actor named [[Mikey Simon]] whose appearance is "rendered in a thick-line, pop-graphic, American cartoon style". He travels to [[Japan]] to star in a [[tokusatsu]] show called LilyMu, where his anime-influenced co-stars represent common anime clichés.

body: On June 12th, 2016, e-hentai.org user caglioro2016 posted a pornographic Spanish language comic book adaptation of the American animated television series [[The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy]]. The first page of the comic, which inspired the memes, features the character Billy walking up to Mandy, spanking her on the buttocks and saying, "Buenos dias Mandy" ("Good morning Mandy"). Mandy turns, punches in the face and says, "Imbecil!" ("Moron!") The force of the punch knocks Billy onto the street, where a car runs over his hands.

body:

title: pentagram
body:
A five-pointed [[star (symbol)|]] drawn with five straight lines.

Can (but not always) contain within itself, but not to be confused with, a [[pentagon_(shape)|pentagon]].

Wiccans (a modern [[witch]] religion) use a pentagram with three points up as a holy symbol, often drawn within a circle, while Satanists use a [[inverted pentagram]], often inscribed in a double circle with the head of a [[goat]] inside the pentagram.

In Japanese culture, this symbol (五芒星) is strongly associated with "[i]Abe no Seimei[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abe_no_Seimei, Japan's most renowned "onmyouji":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onmy%C5%8Dji.

body:
The scorpion pose or vrischikasana (sanskirt meaning scorpion posture) is a [[yoga]] position and variant positions where the body is balanced in a [[handstand]], on the forearms, or on the chest with the body raised, the back arched, and the legs bent.  

A variant of this bends only one leg, with the other leg straight in the direction the head is facing.

body:
A feeling of contempt or scorn. 

[quote]The cat viewed the cheap supermarket catfood with [b]disdain[/b] and stalked away. [/quote]

One might get the sense that the character is looking down on another and casting harsh judgment due to that other's perceived inferiority. Similar to [[smug]]ness, where a character feels perceived superiority instead of casting judgment on another.

title: kuznetsov-class_aircraft_carrier
body:
A class of three [[aircraft carrier]]s built in the later days of the [[Soviet]] Union. Originally two were planned, which only one, the [[Admiral Kuznetsov (aircraft Carrier)|]], was completed for [[Soviet navy]] service. 

The second ship, later known as [[Liaoning (aircraft carrier)|]], was left unfinished in Ukraine after the fall of USSR until sold to [[China]] under a guise for a floating casino in 1998, and were then later rebuilt as a functional carrier. The third ship, [[Shandong (aircraft carrier)|]], is a reverse-engineered version of the ship that were laid down in 2015 and completed in 2019.

Currently, all three ships of the class are currently in service. One with the [[Russian Navy]] and two with the [[People's Liberation Army Navy]].

This is a catchall tag for the ship class. If the individual ship can be identified, then the tag for each ship should be applied accordingly.

title: yamato_(battleship)
body:
[b]Yamato[/b] was a massive battleship of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], active during [[World War II]]. The Yamato-class displaced 72000 tonnes, carried 46 cm (18.1 inch) guns and boasted a great amount of armor, with the waterline belt alone reaching 41 cm in thickness. They were the largest battleships commissioned by any navy during WWII.

Designed between 1934 and 1936, her keel was laid down on 4 November 1937 and she was launched on 8 August 1940. Yamato wasn't commissioned until 16 December 1941, just over a week after the Pearl Harbor attack. Secrecy was maintained throughout her construction with canopies erected at the slipway to hide her from view. Her commissioning was only a simple ceremony and even after completion multiple other warships were docked in a strategic manner to hide her from being seen.

Yamato was also known for her high level of luxury for an IJN battleship, as she was designed as the flagship of the Combined Fleet. She sported ice cream machines, ramune machines, large baths and lockers for all crew. The crewmen slept in bunks rather than tatami like most IJN warships. Yamato was also fully air-conditioned. These luxurious fitting, as well as her rather unimpressive battle record for a ship of her size ended up giving her the nickname "Yamato Hotel".

Alongside her famed 46 cm guns, Yamato was initially equipped with 15.5 cm guns in four triple turrets. By 1945 she had the two 15.5 cm beam turrets removed in favor of more anti-air guns to combat the ever increasing threat of aerial attacks. She only fired her massive main guns once during the Battle off Samar. Yamato never got to fight any other battleship as she was designed for, as carriers and naval aviation became more prevalent. This was perfectly demonstrated when she sank in [[Operation Ten-gou]], after being attacked by over 400 US Navy airplanes.

Today, Yamato appears in numerous media, including anime like [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] and [[Strike Witches]] and personified as a human in [[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]] and [[Kantai Collection]].

h4. See also

* [[Yamato (Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio)|]] ([[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]])
* [[Yamato (KanColle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
* [[Super Yamato]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Japanese battleship Yamato":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_battleship_Yamato

title: tsuba_(guard)
body:
The [b]tsuba (鐔 or 鍔)[/b] is usually a round or occasionally squarish guard at the end of the grip of bladed Japanese weapons, like the "[[katana]]" and its various declinations ("tachi", "wakizashi" etc.), "tanto", or "naginata". They contribute to the control of the arm (the right index of the fighter typically touches the "tsuba"), and to the protection of the hand.

The most common shapes of tsuba are [i]round (maru gata)[/i], [i]rounded-square (kaku gata)[/i] and [i]four lobed (mokko)[/i] with many variations within each basic design.

h4. See also

* [[katana]]
* [[koshirae]]
* [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]]
* [[wakizashi]]

title: katana
body:
A type of Japanese [[sword]] ([i]nihontou[/i]), and is often called a "samurai sword" because of its historical associations with feudal-era Japan.

The katana is characterized by its distinctive appearance: a curved, slender, single-edged blade, circular or squared [[tsuba (guard)|guard]], and long grip to accommodate two hands (the hilt is often given a distinctive wrapping of silk known as [i][[tsuka-ito|tsukaito]][/i]).

The sword preceding the katana is called a [[tachi (weapon)|]]. The general difference between a tachi and a katana is how they are carried. The tachi is suspended from one’s waist belt with the cutting edge facing down, while the katana is thrust through the waist belt, edge facing up. Also, in general the tachi is more curved and longer than the katana.

title: uso_ewin
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He is the main protagonist of [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]Uso Ewin[/b] is a 13-year-old boy who finds himself caught in the middle of a space war and ends up taking the controls of the titular [[V Gundam]] -and later the [[V2 Gundam]]- to assist the [[earth_federation|League Militaire]] against the radical and oppressive [[Zanscare]] Empire.

He is one of the youngest Gundam pilots ever.

title: f91_gundam
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam F91]] anime film from 1991.

[b]F91 Gundam F91[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] experimental miniaturized [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the F (Formula) Project, intended to downsize and reduce the costs of MSs to break [[Anaheim Electronics]]'s monopoly over them. It was much smaller than its predecessors, but had even more powerful thrusters, granting it fantastic mobility. 

It could carry the ferocious and extremely destructive Variable Speed Beam Rifles, and its [[psycho_frame|biocomputer]] enabled a greater link of pilot and machine. The full-spec unit was piloted by [[Seabook Arno]] against the evil [[Crossbone Vanguard]].

title: fallout:_new_vegas
body:
[b][i]Fallout: New Vegas[/i][/b] is a 2010 action role-playing game developed by Obsidian Entertainment and published by Bethesda. It is the fourth major installment of the [[Fallout]] video game series. 

Set in the Mojave Desert 204 years after a devastating nuclear war, the player controls a courier who wakes up after being shot in the head by an unknown assailant. While tracking down their assailant, the courier becomes embroiled in a larger conflict between different governing factions vying for control of the region. 

The game also has four DLC story add-ons, them being Dead Money, Honest Hearts, Old World Blues and Lonesome Road.

title: rwby
body:
Running 3DCG series created by the late [[Monty Oum]] for [[Roosterteeth|Rooster Teeth]]. The setting is Remnant, a world of technology and supernatural forces. The main protagonists are Team RWBY: [[Ruby Rose]], [[Weiss Schnee]], [[Blake Belladonna]], and [[Yang Xiao Long]].  

A chibi spinoff series titled [[RWBY Chibi]] was released in 2016, and a board game titled [[RWBY: Combat Ready]] was released in 2018. An anime adaptation of the franchise titled [[RWBY Ice Queendom|RWBY: Ice Queendom]] began airing in the Summer 2022 season.

Following Rooster Teeth's shutdown on May 15th, 2024, the rights to the RWBY franchise were bought by [[viz (company)|Viz Media]] on July 6, 2024.

Characters from the series are featured in [[BlazBlue: Cross Tag Battle]].

title: vault_boy
body:
Mascot of the Vault-tec company, a major technological developer of the [[Fallout]] universe, before that world's atomic apocalypse. This is also the mascot of all the game's perks and traits. In the [[fallout (prime video)|Fallout TV series]], it is revealed the Vault Boy was inspired by [[the ghoul (fallout tv series)|Cooper Howard]], who was the original mascot and spokesperson for Vault-tec.

The Vault Boy and the "T51-b Power Armor" are the two most iconic elements in the [[Fallout]] series.

title: ember_celica_(rwby)
body:
[[Yang Xiao Long]]'s signature weapons in [[RWBY]]. They are a pair of Dual Ranged Shot Gauntlets (DRSG). After she lost her right arm, she received a robotic arm with a shotgun installed to make up for the lost gauntlet. It was later upgraded in Volume 7, once Yang arrived in Atlas.

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wiki: Ember Celica":https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Ember_Celica

title: neopolitan_(rwby)
body:
Villain from [[rwby|RWBY]]. The right-hand woman of [[Roman Torchwick]], with whom she shares an obvious love of trolling. She fights with an [[umbrella]], uses illusions solid enough to shatter like glass when struck, and doesn't speak aloud (but does have a voice actress). Her backstory is fleshed out in the tie-in novel [i]RWBY: Roman Holiday[/i], where her birth name is revealed to be Trivia Vanille.

Neo has [[pink_hair|pink]], [[brown_hair|brown]], and [[white_hair|white]] [[multicolored hair]] to match her namesake [[Neapolitan ice cream]]; her eyes can also change between [[pink_eyes|pink]], [[brown_eyes|brown]], and/or [[white_eyes|white]] in any combination (with or without [[heterochromia]], and in different orders).  At 4'9'' in high heels Neo is the shortest humanoid character in the series — [[Yang Xiao Long|Yang]] is a full head taller.

title: homurabara_academy_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by high school students at Homurabara Academy in [[Fate/stay night]] and [[Fate/kaleid liner PRISMA ILLYA]].

The male uniform consists of a [[brown jacket]] with a [[breast pocket]] and [[brown pants]].

The female uniform consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[brown vest]] (or sometimes a [[brown jacket]]), a [[black skirt|black]] or [[brown skirt|brown]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[medium skirt]], and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]] with a [[cross print]] on it.

title: hawaiian_pizza
body:
A Hawaiian pizza, also known as pineapple pizza, is a [[pizza]] topped with [[pineapple]], ham (or Canadian bacon/salame/etc), tomato sauce and cheese.

The dish tends to spark debate regarding the inclusion of [[pineapple on pizza]].

Despite what the name might suggest (which was actually inspired by the canned pineapple brand used by the pizza's inventor at the time), it was invented in Canada by the Greek immigrant Sotirios "Sam" Panopoulos.

title: piapro_studio
body:
[b]Piapro[/b], short for "Peer Production", can refer to several entities owned by Crypton Future Media, Inc:
* [b]Piapro Family[/b], the group of characters owned by Crypton Future Media: [[MEIKO (vocaloid)|]], [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]], [[Hatsune Miku]], [[Kagamine Rin]] / [[kagamine_len|Len]], and [[Megurine Luka]]. Also referred to as "Cryptonloids" by fans.
* [b]piapro.jp[/b], a website for hosting art, music, and writing related to [[Vocaloid]], especially the Piapro Family.
* [b]Piapro Studio[/b], the name for two distinct vocal synth software:
** The original one is a plugin for digital audio workstations used for working with Vocaloids. It runs on the VOCALOID engine and is more-or-less a wrapped version of the VOCALOID software.
** The newer one is a standalone engine completely separate from VOCALOID and developed by Crypton themselves.

This tag mainly refers to [[hatsune miku (nt)|voicebanks]] using the standalone Piapro engine.

title: ghoul_(fallout)
body: Humans who survived the nuclear bombings in [[Fallout]] but were mutated, burning their skin until it [[wrinkled skin|wrinkled]] and lost their hair. Some ghouls have maintained their sanity but others have turned feral, more resembling [[zombie]]s.

title: fallout_2
body:
The second game in the [[Fallout]] series, and the sequel to [[Fallout 1]].

The game takes place in 2241, 80 years after the events of [[Fallout 1]] and 164 years after the Great War. It follows [[the Chosen One]], a descendant of the [[Vault Dweller]] from Fallout 1, and their quest to save their tribe by finding the Garden of Eden Creation Kit.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Fallout 2":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallout_2]

title: fat_man_(fallout)
body:
The Fat Man is a recurring fictional [[weapon]] in [[Fallout]] series.

The Fat Man is a shoulder-mounted tactical nuclear catapult. It is heavy, but very powerful. First entered service in September 2077 with the U.S. Army. The weapon is presented in different versions throughout the game series.

For the real life atomic bomb which this weapon is based on and named after, use [[Fat Man (bomb)]] instead.

title: fallout_3
body:
Fallout 3 is an action role-playing shooter released by Bethesda Game Studios and the third major game in the [[Fallout]] series. It differs in many ways from its predecessors, [[Fallout 1|Fallout]] and [[Fallout 2]], although core elements from those games ([[Vault Boy]], familiar enemies, etc.) stay mostly untouched.

h4. Characters

* [[Colonel Autumn]]

title: feral_ghoul
body:
In the [[Fallout]] series, feral ghouls are irradiated humans that have lost their ability to reason and have become aggressive. Much prejudice from ordinary humans against ghouls who retain their mental faculties is due to the widespread assumption that this feral state is the inevitable condition of every ghoul.

title: nuka_cola
body:
Nuka-Cola is a soft [[drink]] in [[Fallout]].

It is the flagship product of the Nuka-Cola Corporation and one of the symbols of United States culture. Introduced in 2044, it rapidly dominated the soft drink market, eventually becoming the most popular soda on the market and a staple of American culture. In the aftermath of the "Great War":https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/Great_War Nuka-Cola [[bottle cap]]s became the de facto currency in most post-War societies.

title: fat_man_(bomb)
body:
A plutonium-infused [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] developed by the United States as a part of the Manhattan Project. It was used during the [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|Atomic Bombing of Nagasaki]] on 9 August, 1945, destroying the city in the process. Fat Man is the second and last nuclear weapon to ever be used in combat.

Despite its relatively short service life, the Fat Man's appearance has been frequently used in popular culture as a stereotypical depiction of an atomic bomb.

This tag is for the real life nuclear weapon, for a fictional weapon in [[Fallout]] series named and modelled after the Fat Man, see [[Fat Man (Fallout)]].

h4. See also
* [[Demon Core]] - a plutonium sphere meant to be used as a core for a second Fat Man bomb
* [[Little Boy (bomb)]]

title: gundam_age-fx
body:
The final lead Gundam of [[gundam_age|Mobile Suit Gundam AGE]]. It is piloted by the series' final protagonist, [[Kio Asuno]]. It is designed in real life by [[Ebikawa Kanetake]].

The Gundam AGE-FX is equipped with a pair of beam sabers in its forearms, similar to the [[gundam_age-3|AGE-3 Gundam AGE-3 Normal]]. The new Stungle Rifle is more powerful than the SigMaxiss Rifle and can be further enhanced with the Daidal Bazooka add-on. But the area where the Gundam AGE-FX shines is its C-Funnels, which are stored across its body. Kio can control these remote weapons with his mind, using them both offensively and defensively. The suit can also make use of [[FX Burst]], a high performance mode that dramatically raises its power levels at the cost of precision control. With the assistance of C-Funnels, Kio can fight equally against Vagan X-Rounders and their remote bit-equipped mobile suits.

The head design of Gundam AGE-FX is different among other Gundam-type mobile suits. It has a blue antenna on the back which enables Kio to control the C-Funnels. There is also a single horizontal line across the mouthpiece and its chin is colored blue instead of the standard red.

Similar to its predecessors being homages of the first 3 lead Gundams of the Universal Century, the Gundam AGE-FX serves as homage to the [[Nu Gundam]] due to having [[funnel (tool)|]] weapons.

title: funnels
body: See [[funnel (tool)|]] for the item, and [[funnels (gundam)]] for the [[Gundam]] drones.

title: funnels_(gundam)
body:
A funnel-shaped drone unit that is designed to be remotely controlled by a Newtype pilot.

It is equipped with a small beam cannon, and an energy cell to propel the funnel when it is operating. A Newtype pilot is able to control these funnels with great precision, allowing them to remotely attack an enemy from all directions, making a funnel-equipped mobile suit extremely deadly. When the funnels are not in use, they are attached to the mother suit's surface hardpoints for recharging.

Although early funnels can indeed resemble funnels, they can come in a variety of shapes. 

Funnels also has multiple variations throughout the Gundam metaverse: 
* [[bit (gundam)|Bits]] (Its larger predecessor which are equipped with on-board generators, eliminating the need to re-dock with the mother suit for recharging. Non-UC versions, however, functions like a funnel due to their need for recharging.)
* [[incom_(gundam)|Incom]]s (A wire-controlled variation)
* [[Fin Funnels]] (Miniaturized bits used by the [[Nu Gundam]]/[[Hi-Nu Gundam]])
* Shield Funnels ([[Unicorn Gundam]]'s shields, each equipped with a beam gatling gun. Its function as remote weapons is only available if the Unicorn is on its Awakened [[NT-D]] Mode. [[Unicorn Gundam Phenex]] has a variant which lacks the beam gatling gun attachment and its form of offense is ramming onto targets. It is also equipped with tail stabilizers)
* [[Psycho Plates]] (Remote controlled Newtype weapons used by the [[Moon Gundam (Mobile Suit)|Moon Gundam]], inherited from the [[Psycho Gundam Mk-IV G-Doors]])
* Funnel Missiles (Equipped on both [[Penelope (Hathaway's Flash)|Penelope]] and [[Xi Gundam]], this type of funnels functions like remote controlled missiles, guided by the pilot's Newtype abilities and exploding upon impact)
* DRAGOONs (a.k.a. Disconnected Rapid Armament Group Overlook Operation Network, exclusive in   [[Gundam SEED]] and [[Gundam SEED Destiny]])
* Fangs (exclusive in [[Gundam 00]] and [[Gundam 00 A Wakening of the Trailblazer]])

This type of weapon is not only exclusive to the Gundam franchise (although it has variety of names and different technology if it shows up in series unrelated to Gundam). Examples are [[Nirvash|Nirvash Spec-V/V3]]'s Options, [[Tauburn (Star Driver)|Tauburn]]'s Piles, [[Armored Core]]'s Orbit Cannons and Exceed Orbit, [[Takamachi Nanoha]]'s Blaster Bits and [[Eva 13]]'s RS Hoppers.

title: m1_abrams
body:
The M1 Abrams is the current main battle [[tank]] of the United States Army. Entering service in 1980, it replaced the Vietnam-era M60 Patton. It uses composite armor, and its distinctive slab-sided turret, with its sloping panels, is a consequence of this. Its gas turbine engine resides in a raised afterdeck.

The Abrams was originally armed with a 105mm [[cannon]], subsequently upgraded to 120mm. Other weapons includes a roof-mounted .50 caliber M2 machine gun and 2 7.62mm [[machine gun|machine guns]]. These may be supplanted by remotely-controlled weapon stations using a Mk. 19 automatic grenade launcher or an M134 [[gatling gun|Minigun]].

It is the vehicular motif of the [[Decepticon]] [[Brawl (transformers)|]] in the [[Transformers]] live-action films.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M1 Abrams":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1_Abrams

title: type_99_light_machine_gun
body:
The Type 99 Light Machine Gun was a [[light machine gun]] designed for the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] for [[World War II]].  

The main reason for its development was the Type 99 used a 7.7mm [[cartridge]], while the older Type 96 used a 6.5mm cartridge.  The Imperial Japanese Army wanted to move the standard ammunition of the whole army to "7.7x58mm Arisaka,":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/7.7×58mm_Arisaka including a Type 99 Rifle introduced the same year, so that all soldiers could share ammunition. The previous 6.5mm cartridge was not considered powerful enough. 

However, they introduced the cartridge in 1939, just before the start of the war, and not enough of the new weapons could be produced. The Type 99 served alongside the Type 96 it was meant to replace, functionally resulting in just adding another set of ammunition and set of weapons that had to be tracked, rather than simplifying the process. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Type 99 light machine gun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_99_light_machine_gun

A playable unit in [[Last Origin]].

She is a bioroid belonging to the Battle Maids Project series and is part of Squad 21. She is one of the first characters met by the [[Commander (last origin)|]].

Her weapon of choice is a custom [[Winchester Model 1866]] and she is often accompanied by her [[dog]], called [[Bori (last origin)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[green eyes]], and has [[large breasts]]. Her base skin consists of a [[maid]] outfit, featuring a prominent [[underboob cutout]], a short [[maid apron|apron]] and a [[miniskirt]]. She wears a [[pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. On her head she dons a [[maid headdress|headdress]] and a pair of [[round eyewear|round glasses]]. Her hair is styled in [[ponytail]] using a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]].

She was designed by [[kakiman]] and is voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]] in the Japanese version.
