title: winchester_model_1894
body:
A [[lever-action]] repeating [[rifle]] designed in 1894 by John Browning. By far the most popular of the Winchester rifle family, the Model 1894 was the first commercially-available rifle to chamber cartridges using smokeless powder and is the best-selling high-powered rifle in US history, with more than 7 million units sold. Reproductions are still in production today.

As opposed to its predecessor, the [[winchester_model_1873|Model 1873]], the Model 1894 can be distinguished by its rounded receiver (the 1873 is more blocky) as well as being smaller in size by comparison. However, like the Model 1873, the Model 1894 features a grey-colored steel receiver, as opposed to the yellowish gunmetal seen on the [[winchester_model_1866|Model 1866]].

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia: "Winchester Model 1894":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winchester_Model_1894

title: winchester_model_1873
body:
The "Gun that Won the West", the .44 caliber Winchester Model 1873 was one of the most popular single firearms of the 19th Century, with over 700,000 sold by the time production ceased. The Model 1873 is distinguished from its predecessor, the [[winchester model 1866|Model 1866]], by its grey-colored steel receiver, and from its successor the [[winchester model 1894|Model 1894]] by it's size and the fact that its receiver is a squared shape, while the latter is smaller and more rounded. 

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

title: winchester_model_1866
body:
The first in the long and hugely successful series of Winchester lever-action rifles, developed from the 1860 [[Henry rifle]].  The Winchester '66 can readily be distinguished from the Henry by the presence of a wooden forward stock, and by the King's Patent Loading Gate on the right side of the receiver. It can be distinguished from subsequent Winchester lever guns by the fact that its receiver is, like the Henry's, made from yellow gunmetal (a bronze/brass alloy) rather than steel.

title: royce_and_royce_(umamusume)
body:
A character in the [i][[Umamusume (anime)|]][/i] anime who made her appearance in the third season, initially as a background character with only the last letter of her name visible, who happened to be part of Team Canopus. She would formally be introduced in Episode 12, just hours after her profile was released.

This dramaturge of a thoroughbred wants to cast herself in the role of "The Strongest".

Her obsession about that title is based around the fact that the original horse was (jokingly or not) given various variants of the title of "The Strongest X", where "X" meant "maiden horse", "single win horse" or "third place horse" at various times due to how often victory eluded the real [[Royce and Royce (racehorse)|]].

Voiced by [[Tanabe Rui]].

title: star_trek:_lower_decks
body:
A 2020-2024 animated comedy [[Star Trek]] spin-off.  The series follows the events revolving around 4 junior officers aboard the USS Cerritos, a California-class starship whose primary missions were more focused on more mundane Federation tasks.

The series is named and inspired after [[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]'s episode "Lower Decks" that also followed the events of several junior officers.

title: feather_(magia_record)
body:
A Feather is a low- or mid-ranking member of either Wings of Magius, Neomagius or Chargius within the [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]] universe.

They are characterized by a uniform featuring a hooded garment with a print of a given organization's symbol and a [[pendant]] shaped like [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]].
 
Within Wings of Magius, that uniform consists of a [[black cloak|black]] or [[white cloak|white]] [[cloak]] with a [[hooded cloak|hood]] featuring a print of a moth's eyes and antennae.

Chargius uses the same design as Wings of Magius, except the cloak is [[yellow cloak|yellow]].

Neomagius further divides the outfits depending on their ranks:
* A Black Feather's uniform consists of a [[hood]] with a print of [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]], the aforementioned pendant, a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[turtleneck dress|turtleneck]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[tabard]] and [[blue pantyhose|blue]] [[pantyhose]].
* A White Feather's uniform consists of a [[hood]] with a print of [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]], the aforementioned pendant, a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[frilled sleeves]], a pair of [[bracelet]]s, [[white gloves]], a [[tabard]], [[blue pantyhose|blue]] [[pantyhose]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]].

h4. External links
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Wings of the Magius":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Wings_of_the_Magius]
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Neomagius":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Neo-Magius]

title: undersuit
body:
When a character is not wearing multiple outer garments that who normally wears, and exposing the inner clothing that is not normally exposed (or partially exposed), but it is not [[underwear only]].
Or the [[undershirt]], [[bodysuit under clothes]], etc. are almost completely exposed with no outer clothes worn.
If the character is simply not wearing one of the outer garments (like [[jacket]], [[cape]], etc), please mainly use no_xx ([[no jacket]], [[no cape]], etc), unless the outer garment usually covers a large area of the inner clothing.

h4. See also

* [[bodysuit]]
** [[bodysuit under clothes]]
* [[leotard under clothes]]
* [[undershirt]]
** [[undershirt peek]]
* [[underwear]]
* [[clothes on and off]]

title: alina_gray
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]] and one of the three leaders of the Wings of Magius. Her [[Doppel (madoka magica)|]] form is [[Old Dorothy]]/[[Neo Dorothy Motherfucker]]. Often seen with her kouhai [[Misono Karin]].

She has [[aqua eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[green hair]] with a yellow [[streaked hair|streak]], [[sidelocks]], [[blunt ends]] and a [[hair between eyes|lock between her eyes]].

In her daily life she wears the [[Sakae General School uniform]], accessorized with a [[loose bowtie]], [[sleeves rolled up]], [[red wristband|red]] [[wristband]]s, a [[side-tie shirt]], a [[belt pouch]] with a [[paint stains|paint-stained]] [[cleaning rag]] and [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks|white]] [[socks]]. Her hair is also tied into a [[single hair ring|ring]].

As a [[Magical Girl]] she wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[peaked cap]] with a [[green gemstone]], a [[white collar|white]] [[detached collar]], a [[black necktie|black]] [[cross tie]] with a green [[brooch]], a [[black vest|black]] [[v-neck]] [[vest]] with [[notched lapels]]; [[see-through sleeves|translucent]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[puffy short sleeves]] with [[sleeve cuffs|cuffs]], [[fur cuffs]], a [[black bow|black]] [[waist bow]] with a [[chain]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[multicolored skirt|multicolored]] [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-striped]] [[miniskirt]], [[garter straps]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[fur trim|fur-trimmed]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet]] [[fur-trimmed thighhighs|thighhighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[fold-over boots]].

She is voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #23379269

body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is one of the three leaders of the Wings of Magius and best friends with [[Satomi Touka|Touka]] & [[Tamaki Ui|Ui]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] stylized in [[hair rings]], [[twin braids]] & [[parted bangs|parted]] [[bangs]]. As a [[magical girl]] she wears a [[black cape|black]] [[cape]], a [[black headwear|black]] [[mortarboard]] [[hat]], [[tassel]], [[yellow dress]], and [[black  pantyhose]]. Usually seen [[holding book|holding]] a [[book]].

She is voiced by [[Morohoshi Sumire]].

title: falin_touden
body:
[[Dungeon Meshi]] character.

A [[falin touden (tallman)|tallman]] spellcaster, [[Laios Touden]]'s younger sister and [[Marcille Donato]]'s classmate. Her rescue is the main goal of the party. She saved the party from total defeat at the jaws of a red [[dragon]] by teleporting them away, but was eaten herself. [spoilers]The party killed the dragon and resurrected her, but she was turned into [[falin touden (chimera)|a chimera]] by the [[thistle (dungeon meshi)|mad sorcerer]].[/spoilers]

Like her brother, she has [[brown eyes]] (although they are often [[closed eyes|closed]]) and [[grey hair|platinum]]-[[blonde hair|blonde]] hair. Her adventuring garb includes a [[blue headwear|blue hat]] and [[blue robe|blue]]-and-[[white robe]], and she wields a [[mace]] that resembles a street light.

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/54ff722f-bb04-4fdf-97d1-6ea50585992e/1]

title: orie_mishiro
body:
織衛 御白 (おりえ みしろ)

Mishiro is a character originally designed for [[Pixiv Fantasia Fallen Kings]] by [[konshin]].

She is a white fox girl with [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]] with the tips [[gradient_hair|fading to blue]], [[blue eyes]] along with (obviously) drooping [[fox ears]] and a fluffy [[fox tail]].

She has the ability to turn into a [[fox]] and into a [[sword]]. She is the wife (and main weapon) of [[Orie Jinku]]. With him, she produced four children: [[orie_hakua|Hakua]], [[orie_kureha|Kureha]], [[orie_mitsugi|Mitsugi]], and [[orie_mihane|Mihane]].

This tag is for standalone collars not part of a shirt. Do not use this tag for [[collared shirt]]s, [[collared dress]]es, [[wing collar]]s, [[sailor collar]]s, etc.

Not to be confused with a [[choker]], which is usually tighter-fitting and made of thinner material.

title: mauser_98
body:
A series of [[bolt action]] [[rifle]]s designed and manufactured by Mauser, chambered for 7.92×57mm and utilizing a 5-round internal magazine. The Mauser 98 is recognizable by its two handguard metal bands on the front (one serves for sling swivels), ability to store a [[cleaning rod]] inside the lower handguard, and semi-grip buttstock.

This tag includes any variants, such as:

* [b]Gewehr 98[/b], introduced in 1898. The original model that served the German military during [[World War I]]. Has a straight bolt handle.
* [b]Karabiner 98k[/b], introduced in 1935. Essentially the shortened Gewehr 98 of it with a bent bolt. Used by the Germans during [[World War II]]. Generally known as "Kar 98" (with or without space) for short.
* Other foreign-produced copies such as the Polish Wz.29 and Chinese "Type 24":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiang_Kai-shek_rifle].

h4. See also

* [[Gewehr 41]]
* [[Kar98k (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gewehr 98":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gewehr_98
* "Wikipedia: Karabiner 98 kurz":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karabiner_98k

title: spread_pussy_from_compression
body:
The [[pussy]] is spread open due to external compression, such as from pressing against an object or surface, without the use of hands or sexual actions like [[gaping]]. This tag focuses on the visible effect of deformation caused by pressure.

h4. See also

[[against transparent object]]
[[ass press]]

title: chuckya
body:
An enemy introduced in [[Super Mario 64]]. If they grab you, they'll chuck you away. 

Their body is that of a purple sphere and they have red spheres for hands as well as a red sphere on top of an antennae above their head. [[Super Mario 64 DS]] gives them a yellow wind up key in the back.

Despite being related to the [[Bob-Omb]]s, it does not have a fuse or explode in a way a bomb would.

title: api:bulk_update_requests
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Create":#dtext-create
** 4.04 "Update":#dtext-update
** 4.05 "Delete":#dtext-delete
** 4.06 "Approve":#dtext-approve
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the upload records through the API.

[tn][b]Note:[/b] Only upload records created by oneself are visible, unless you are an Admin ([[Help:Users]]).[/tn]

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]user_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]script[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][code][pending, approved, rejected, processing, failed][/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]user[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "bulk_update_requests"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "bulk_update_request"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with bulk update request records.

[hr]

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_requests.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. Search attributes

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b][[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b][[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]][/b]
** [code]script[/code]
* [b][[help:user_syntax|User syntax]][/b]
** [code]user[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [b][[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]][/b]
** [code]forum_topic[/code]
** [code]forum_post[/code]
** [code]tags[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. Special search parameters

* [code]status[/code] - The status of the bulk update request (separated by commas).

[hr]

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_requests/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h5#Create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Mandatory[/b]:
** [code]script[/code]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]reason[/code]
** [code]forum_topic_id[/code]

[b]Note:[/b]If forum topic ID is present, then title will be ignored. If forum topic ID is absent, then title will be used to create a new forum topic. The reason will be used to create a new forum post.

[hr]

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#update-parameters. Update parameters

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]script[/code]

* [b]Admin-only parameters[/b]:
** [code]forum_post_id[/code]
** [code]forum_topic_id[/code]

[hr]

h5#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] Only the user that created the bulk update request or an Admin may delete it.

[hr]

h5#approve. Approve

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id/approve.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] Builders and above can approve bulk update requests that:

[quote]
* Rename or alias
* Only artist tags
* Post count must be less than 200
[/quote]

Otherwise, only an admin may approve that request.
[hr]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/bulk_update_requests_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/bulk_update_request.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/bulk_update_request_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: iterator_(rain_world)
body:
In the game [[Rain World]], Iterators are sapient artificial intelligences running on semi-biological supercomputers of colossal scale (large enough to build cities on top of). Most often an Iterator is depicted through its "puppet": a [[humanoid robot]] connected to the hardware via an umbilical cable. Each Iterator's puppet has a characteristic design which includes [[colored skin|skin color]], a unique [[forehead mark]]. and various styles of [[robot ears]].

Two Iterators can be met in the course of regular gameplay:
* [[Looks to the Moon]]
* [[Five Pebbles]]

An additional three Iterators cannot be met, but have a canonical appearance and play a major role in the events and lore of the game.
* [[No Significant Harassment]]
* [[Seven Red Suns]]
* [[Sliver of Straw]]

Consistently, Moon and Straw take female pronouns (and Moon self-identifies as "Big Sis Moon"), Five Pebbles and NSH take male pronouns, while Seven Red Suns takes singular neuter "they".

title: shishiro_botan_(button-down)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costime]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shishiro Botan]].

This costume has 2 different variations for the top:
* A [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], with a red [[bolo tie]] and either a [[black vest|black]] [[waistcoat]] or an [[underbust]] [[chest harness]]
* A [[black sports bra]] and [[dog tags]]

Both versions share the same bottom consisting of a pair of [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with [[legwear garter]]s/[[thigh strap]]s, [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[ankle boots]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Very long hair|Very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[grey hair]] with [[hair flaps]] and [[sidelocks]]
* [[Short hair|Short]] grey [[streaked hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #4748734: Reference sheet
* !post #5218463: Profile (with [[sheep hood]])
* !post #5838040: Merchandise
* !post #4817130: L2D
other_names: 獅白ぼたん(シャツ衣装)

title: shishiro_botan_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Shishiro Botan]].

It consists of a [[crop top|cropped]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[skin tight]] [[black shirt]] with a [[see-through cleavage]] section, a [[necklace]] a [[black jacket|black]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[zipper skirt]] [[miniskirt]], [[torn pantyhose|torn]] [[black pantyhose|black]] [[single leg pantyhose]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4035602: Profile
* !post #5838096: Reference sheet
* !post #4049660: L2D

title: cereza
body: [[Bayonetta]]'s [[aged down|younger]] self.

title: bayonetta
body:
The main character of the action game series [[bayonetta (series)|Bayonetta]]. She uses pistols and magical attacks to defeat enemies.

The guns attached to her [[high heels]] are [[ankle gun]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Cereza]]

title: api:users
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 1. "Bit fields":#dtext-bit-fields
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Create":#dtext-create
** 4.04 "Update":#dtext-update
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the user records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]

[/thead]

[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]level[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][10, 20, 30, 31, 32, 40, 50][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]inviter_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_update_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]note_update_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_upload_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]favorite_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]unread_dmail_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_banned[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]bit_prefs[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]Each bit stores a boolean value. See "Bit fields":[#dtext-bit-fields] below for more information.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]theme[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][light, dark][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]favorite_tags[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]blacklisted_tags[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]comment_threshold[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]timezone[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]per_page[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]1 - 200[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]default_image_size[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][large, original][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]custom_css[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]upload_points[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_forum_read_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_logged_in_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#bit-fields. Bit fields

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Bit position[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]is_banned[/code][/td]
[td]status[/td]
[td]0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]receive_email_notifications[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]2[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]always_resize_images[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]3[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]setting[/td]
[td]4[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]setting[/td]
[td]5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]setting[/td]
[td]6[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]setting[/td]
[td]7[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]setting[/td]
[td]8[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]style_usernames[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]9[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_auto_complete[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]show_deleted_children[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]11[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_categorized_saved_searches[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]15[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_tagged_filenames[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]17[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_cropped_thumbnails[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]19[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_mobile_gestures[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]20[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_safe_mode[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]21[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_desktop_mode[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]22[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_post_tooltips[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]23[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_recommended_posts[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]24[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]requires_verification[/code][/td]
[td]status[/td]
[td]28[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_verified[/code][/td]
[td]status[/td]
[td]29[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]inviter[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "users"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "user"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with user records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is created at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]level[/code]
** [code]post_upload_count[/code]
** [code]post_update_count[/code]
** [code]note_update_count[/code]
** [code]favorite_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]inviter[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the name field.
* [code]min_level[/code] - Minimum user level to include.
* [code]max_level[/code] - Maximum user level to include.
* [code]current_user_first[/code] - Shows the current user first, then all other users by ID desc.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical on the name field.
** [code]post_upload_count[/code]
** [code]post_update_count[/code]
** [code]note_count[/code]

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the user ID.
Can also be reached by using the [code]/profile[/code] endpoint for the current user.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]password[/code]
** [code]password_confirmation[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]email[/code]

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the user ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]comment_threshold[/code]
** [code]default_image_size[/code]
** [code]favorite_tags[/code]
** [code]blacklisted_tags[/code]
** [code]time_zone[/code]
** [code]per_page[/code]
** [code]custom_style[/code]
** [code]theme[/code]
** [code]receive_email_notifications[/code]
** [code]always_resize_images[/code]
** [code]enable_post_navigation[/code]
** [code]new_post_navigation_layout[/code]
** [code]enable_private_favorites[/code]
** [code]enable_sequential_post_navigation[/code]
** [code]show_deleted_posts[/code]
** [code]style_usernames[/code]
** [code]enable_auto_complete[/code]
** [code]show_deleted_children[/code]
** [code]disable_categorized_saved_searches[/code]
** [code]disable_tagged_filenames[/code]
** [code]disable_cropped_thumbnails[/code]
** [code]disable_mobile_gestures[/code]
** [code]enable_safe_mode[/code]
** [code]enable_desktop_mode[/code]
** [code]disable_post_tooltips[/code]
* [b]Admin only:[/b]
** [code]level[/code]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]

[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/user_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:uploads
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the upload records through the API.

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "uploads"
** Used in the URL pathname

** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with upload records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record

* 4. "Index":#dtext-index

* 6. "Delete":#dtext-delete

[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the tag alias records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]antecedent_name[/code]
** [code]consequent_name[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
* [code]forum_topic[/code]
* [code]forum_post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the antecedent name or consequent name fields.
* [code]status[/code] - Case-insensitive search on the status field.
* [code]category[/code] - Searches on the category of the consequent tag, with support for multiple categories being space-delimited.

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by created_at descending.
* [code]updated_at[/code] - Orders by updated_at descending.
* [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]tag_count[/code] - Orders by post count of the consequent tag, then alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]custom[/code] - See "here":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order] for more info.

[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that last updated the forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]original_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]The first forum post of a forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#Nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "forum_topics"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "forum_topic"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]category_id[/code]
** [code]response_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]title[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]updater[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]forum_posts[/code]
** [code]bulk_update_requests[/code]
** [code]tag_aliases[/code]
** [code]tag_implications[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the title text field.
* [code]status[/code] - The status of an attached [[api:bulk_update_requests|BUR]]. Can be: pending, approved, rejected.
* [code]is_private[/code] - Shows topics that have a min level set or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).
* [code]is_read[/code] - Shows topics that have been read by the user or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).
* [code]is_deleted[/code] - Unless this value is present, [u]deleted forum_topics are hidden[/u].

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]sticky[/code] - Shows sticky topics first, sorted by updated at second.
* [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

The order can also be changed to ID descending by using "sequential pagination":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-sequential].

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Create parameters]]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]category_id[/code] - Can be: 0, 1, 2.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]original_post_attributes[body][/code] - DText that will be used to create a forum post entry at the same time.
*** Is a hash value, so the final parameter format is [code]forum_topic[original_post_attributes][body][/code]

h6.Restricted to Moderator+

* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]min_level[/code] - Can be: 0, 40, 50
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Update parameters]]

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create forum topic action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional. Besides those, it also accepts the following additional optional parameters.

* [code]original_post_attributes[id][/code] - The ID of the the first post on a topic.
** Is a hash value, so the final parameter format is [code]forum_topic[original_post_attributes][id][/code]
** This parameter [u]is required[/u] if the original post's body is being updated as well.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.
Restricted to Moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update forum topic action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.
Restricted to moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update forum topic action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]false[/b].

h4#mark-all-as-read. Mark all as read

Marks every topic as being read.

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/mark_all_as_read.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/forum_topics_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/forum_topic.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/forum_topic_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[td]>0[/td]

[td][/td]

[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]boolean[/td]
[td]obsolete[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]key[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]

[th]Availability[/th]

[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]owner[/code][/td]

[td]single[/td]

[/tbody]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "dmails"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "dmail"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with dmail records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.
Only Dmails to or from the user will be shown, regardless of user level.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]to[/code]
** [code]from[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_read[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the title fields.
* [code]message_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the body field.
* [code]folder_matches[/code]
** [b]received[/b] - Shows all dmails to the user.
** [b]unread[/b] - Shows all unread dmails to the user.
** [b]sent[/b] - Shows all dmails from the user.
** [b]deleted[/b] - Shows all dmails deleted by the user.

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the dmail ID.
Normally only the owner can see the dmail, unless the correct dmail key is also supplied.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#show-parameters. Show parameters.

* [code]key[/code] Unique key for every dmail that will allow anyone to view the dmail.

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [b]To specifier:[/b] - must be one of the following
*** [code]to_id[/code]
*** [code]to_name[/code]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the dmail ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

** [code]is_deleted[/code]

[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_ip_addr[/code][/td]
[td]inet[/td]
[td]Limited to Moderator+[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater_ip_addr[/code][/td]
[td]inet[/td]
[td]Limited to Moderator+[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]

[td]single[/td]

[td][/td]

[tr]
[td][code]post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#Nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "comments"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "comment"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] [code]group_by[/code] as a parameter must be set to [code]comment[/code], or else posts will be returned instead (e.g. [code]group_by=comment[/code]).

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]score[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]body[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]do_not_bump_post[/code]
* [[help:post_syntax|Post syntax]]
** [code]post[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]updater[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]post_id[/code] - Orders by post ID.
** [code]score[/code] - Orders by comment score.
** [code]updated_at[/code] - Orders by [b]updated_at[/b] timestamp.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

** The list of tags is space-delineated
* [code]all_changed_tags[/code] - The same as [code]changed_tags[/code]

* [code]tag_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive search of the tag string with first tag from the input
** If asterisks ( * ) are missing from the input, it adds an asterisk to either side of the tag
* [code]updater_name[/code] - Searches by updater name instead of updater ID
* [code]is_new[/code] - Boolean syntax

The following includes the details of how to interface with the wiki page records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]

[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]

[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]other_names[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]strings[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]locked[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#derived. Derived field format

These are values which are not part of the actual record, but instead are derived from calculations and record lookups on the fly.

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[th]Notes[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]category_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][0,1,3,4,5,null][/td]
[td]It is the [code]category[/code] of the "associated tag":[#dtext-associations] if it exists, otherwise it is null.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]artist[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artists|artist]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]dtext_links[/code][/td]
[td][[api:dtext_links|dtext link]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "wiki_pages"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "wiki_page"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Wiki page versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [[help:array_syntax|Array syntax]]
** [code]other_names[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]tag[/code]
** [code]artist[/code]
** [code]dtext_links[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.
* [code]title_normalize[/code] - Normalized case-insensitive wildcard searching on the title text field.
* [code]other_names_match[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on any of the other names.
* [code]linked_to[/code] - All wiki pages that link to the given wiki title.
* [code]not_linked_to[/code] - All wiki pages that do not link to the given wiki title.
* [code]hide_deleted[/code] - Hides all deleted wikis (boolean syntax).
** Shortcut for [code]search[is_deleted]=false[/code]
* [code]other_names_present[/code] - Shows wikis based on the presence of other names (boolean syntax).
** Shortcut for [code]search[other_name_count]=>0[/code] (TRUE) and [code]search[other_name_count]=0[/code] (FALSE)
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]title[/code] - Alphabetical order on the title.
** [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]title[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]body[/code]
** [code]other_names[/code] - Uses URL array parameter format.
** [code]other_names_string[/code] - Space delimited list of post IDs.
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create wiki page action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update wiki page action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The wiki page version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

title: api:posts
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations

** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Create":#dtext-create
** 4.04 "Update":#dtext-update
** 4.05 "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the post records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_general[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_artist[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_copyright[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_character[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr][tr]
[td][code]tag_string_meta[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]rating[/code][/td]
[td]string or null[/td]
[td]includes [g, s, q, e][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]parent_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer or null[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]source[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]md5[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]file_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]large_file_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]preview_file_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]file_ext[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]file_size[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]image_width[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]score[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]fav_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_general[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_artist[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_copyright[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_character[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_meta[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_comment_bumped_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp or null[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_noted_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp or null[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]has_children[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]image_height[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]parent[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]children[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]artist_commentary[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artist_commentaries|artist_commentary]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]notes[/code][/td]
[td][[api:notes|note]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]comments[/code][/td]
[td][[api:comments|comment]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]flags[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_flags|post flag]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]appeals[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_appeals|post appeals]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approvals[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_approvals|post approval]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]replacements[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_replacement|post replacement]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]pixiv_ugoira_frame_data[/code][/td]
[td][[api:pixiv_ugoira_frame_data|Pixiv ugoira frame data]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "posts"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "post"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Post versions]]

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with upload records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#index-parameters. Index parameters

* [code]tags[/code] - The post query to search for using tags and metatags ([[Help:Cheatsheet]]).
** [code]post[tags][/code] can also be used.
* [code]random[/code] - Selects a random sampling under the post query.
* [code]format[/code] - Chooses which format to return. Can be: html, json, xml, atom.
* [code]md5[/code] - Search for an MD5 match. Takes priority over all other parameters.

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the post ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td]/posts.json[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Mandatory[/b]:
** [code]upload_media_asset_id[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]tag_string[/code]
** [code]rating[/code]
** [code]parent_id[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]artist_commentary_title[/code]
** [code]artist_commentary_desc[/code]
** [code]translated_commentary_title[/code]
** [code]translated_commentary_desc[/code]
** [code]is_pending[/code] - only matters for users with unrestricted uploads.

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]$id is the post ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]tag_string[/code]
** [code]old_tag_string[/code]
** [code]parent_id[/code]
** [code]old_parent_id[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]old_source[/code]
** [code]rating[/code]
** [code]old_rating[/code]
** [code]has_embedded_notes[/code]

h5#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The post version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/posts_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/post.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/post_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:notes
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create":#dtext-create
* 07. "Update":#dtext-update
* 08. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 09. "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 10. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 10. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the note records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]body[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]x[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]y[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]width[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]height[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_active[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]version[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "notes"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "note"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Note versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. Search attributes

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]x[/code]
** [code]y[/code]
** [code]width[/code]
** [code]height[/code]
** [code]version[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_active[/code]
* [b]"Post syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:post_syntax][/b]
** [code]post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. Special search parameters

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This does a redirect to the post with that note when using the HTML interface, specifically highlighting that note when it gets there.

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]post_id[/code] - The post ID the note belongs to.
** [code]x[/code] - X coordinate of the note starting from the left of the image.
** [code]y[/code] - y coordinate of the note starting from the top of the image.
** [code]height[/code]
** [code]width[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]is_active[/code] - Whether the note is active or not (i.e. deleted).

[b]Note:[/b] The note box must fit within the full-size dimensions of the image.

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create note action":[#dtext-create], except for the post ID. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]

title: api:pools
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create":#dtext-create
* 07. "Update":#dtext-update
* 08. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 09. "Undelete":#dtext-undelete
* 10. "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 11. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 12. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the pool records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]description[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_ids[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]integers > 0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]category[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][series, collection][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_active[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td]unused[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

None.

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "pools"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "pool"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Pool versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]description[/code]
* [b]"Array syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:array_syntax][/b]
** [code]post_ids[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Normalized case-insensitive wildcard searching on the name text field.
* [code]description_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the description text field.
* [code]post_tags_match[/code] - The pools's post's tags match the given terms. Meta-tags not supported.
* [code]category[/code]
** [code]series[/code] - Only series-type pools.
** [code]collection[/code] - Only collection-type pools.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of the results.
** [code]name[/code] - Alphabetic order by name.
** [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by creation time.
** [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]category[/code] - Can be: series, collection.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]description[/code]
** [code]post_ids[/code] - Uses URL array parameter format.
** [code]post_ids_string[/code] - Space delimited list of post IDs.
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create pool action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update pool action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update pool action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]false[/b].

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The pool version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/pools_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/pool.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/pool_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:artists
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations

* 04. "Show":#dtext-show

* 09. "Revert":#dtext-revert
