[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the artist records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag format]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]group_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]other_names[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]strings[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_banned[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]members[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artists|artist]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]urls[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artist_urls|artist url]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]wiki_page[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_alias[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "artists"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "artist"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Artist versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]group_name[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_banned[/code]
* [b]"Array syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:array_syntax][/b]
** [code]other_names[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]any_other_name_like[/code] - Search for artists that have an other name matching this value. Supports wildcards.
* [code]any_name_matches [/code] - Search for artists that have a matching name, group name, or other name. Supports wildcards and regexes.
* [code]url_matches[/code] - Search for artists with a matching URL.
** Does a regex match when the query starts and ends with a forward slash "/".
*** Regexes must follow the Ruby's format.
** Does a wildcard match when there are asterisks "*" present.
** Uses the artist URL finder when the value is prefaced by [code]http://[/code] or [code]https://[/code]
*** This does a recursive search on URLs stripping the pathname one level at a time to search for matches.
*** It will keep searching until it finds an exact match or 10 similar entries.
** Otherwise it does a wildcard search with wildcard placed at the start and end.
* [code]any_name_or_url_matches[/code] - Searches for the artist by name or URL.
** Does a URL search if the value is prefaced by [code]http://[/code] or [code]https://[/code]
** Does a name search otherwise.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of the results.
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
** [code]post_count[/code]

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]- The artist tag name.
*** Must be tag format ([[API:tags]]).
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]group_name[/code] - The name of the group this artist belongs to.
** [code]other_names[/code] - List of alternative names for this artist.
*** Space delimited. Replace spaces within names with underscores.
** [code]url_string[/code] - List of URLs associated with this artist
*** Whitespace or newline delimited.
** [code]is_deleted[/code] - Set the artist entry as deleted or not.

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create artist action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] The action can be accomplished using the "update artist action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#banned. Banned

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/banned.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]Redirects to the "index artist action":[#dtext-index] with [code]is_banned[/code] set to [b]true[/b].[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The artist version ID to revert to.

h4#ban. Ban

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]

[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]

[tr]

Restricted to Admins only ([[Help:Users]])[/td]

[/table]

h4#ban. Unban

[tbody]
[tr]

[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/unban.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.
Restricted to Admins only ([[Help:Users]])[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/artists_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]

[td][b]Model[/b][/td]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the forum post records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]

[th]Name[/th]

[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]

[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]

[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that last updated the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Forum topic the forum post is on.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]dtext_links[/code][/td]
[td][[api:dtext_links|dtext link]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Dtext links on the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]votes[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_post_votes|forum post vote]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Any votes the forum post may have.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag alias[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Tag aliases linked to the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag implication[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_implications|tag implication]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Tag implications linked to the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]bulk update request[/code][/td]
[td][[api:bulk_update_requests|bulk update request]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Bulk update requests linked to the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "forum_posts"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "forum_post"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_posts.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]topic_id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]body[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]updater[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]topic[/code]
** [code]dtext_links[/code]
** [code]votes[/code]
** [code]tag alias[/code]
** [code]tag implication[/code]
** [code]bulk update request[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.
* [code]topic_title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the topic title the forum post is on.
* [code]topic_category_id[/code] - Can be: 0, 1, 2 (General, Tags, Bugs & Features respectively).
* [code]linked_to[/code] - Shows forum posts that link to a particular wiki.
** The parameter must use the same format as the wiki title
** I.e. all lowercase and underscores instead of spaces

h5. Search order

The search order is not configurable with a search parameter. However, the order can still be changed to ID descending by using "sequential pagination":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-sequential].

h4#show. Show

[/tr]

[td][b]Description[/b][/td]

[/tr]

[/table]

[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Create parameters]]

** [code]topic_id[/code]

h4#update. Update

title: api:tags
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Update":#dtext-update
* 07. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 08. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the tag records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]category[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]includes [0,1,3,4,5][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>=0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deprecated[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#category. Category

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Value[/th]
[th]Description[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]0[/td]
[td]General[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]1[/td]
[td]Artist[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]3[/td]
[td]Copyright[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]4[/td]
[td]Character[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]5[/td]
[td]Meta[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]wiki_page[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page whose title matches the tag name.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]artist[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artists|artist]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Artist whose name matches the tag name.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_alias[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Alias where the tag is the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_aliases[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Aliases where the tag is the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_implications[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_implications|tag implication]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Implications where the tag is the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_implications[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_implications|tag implication]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Implications where the tag is the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]dtext_links[/code][/td]
[td][[api:dtext_links|dtext link]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Dtext links to the page whose title matches the tag name.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "tags"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "tag"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tags.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]category[/code]
** [code]post_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]name[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deprecated[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]wiki_page[/code]
** [code]artist[/code]
** [code]antecedent_alias[/code]
** [code]consequent_aliases[/code]
** [code]antecedent_implications[/code]
** [code]consequent_implications[/code]
** [code]consequent_implications[/code]
** [code]dtext_links[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]fuzzy_name_matches[/code] - Shows tags with names that are within a certain percentage of similarity.
* [code]name_matches[/code] - Normalized wildcard search on the name field.
* [code]name_normalize[/code] - Normalized wildcard search on the name field that supports multiple tags split by a comma ",".
* [code]name_or_alias_matches[/code] - Normalized wildcard search on the name field that also checks for aliases where the search term is the antecedent.
* [code]hide_empty[/code] - Shows only tags that have a post count greater than 0 ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical order on the name.
* [code]date[/code] - Orders by ID descending.
* [code]count[/code] - Orders by post count.
* [code]similarity[/code] - Orders by similarity to the search term.
** Only when the [code]fuzzy_name_matches[/code] parameter is used.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tags/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the tag ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tags/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the tag ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Update parameters]]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]is_deprecated[/code]
*** can only be set to [code]false[/code] by admins
*** can only be set to [code]true[/code] if the tag has a wiki page, and either its post count is zero or the user is an admin
** [code]category[/code] Restricted by user level
*** Member+: < 50 posts
*** Builder+: < 1000 posts
*** Admin+: No limit

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/tags_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/tag_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]

** [code]updated_at[/code]

* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
* [code]forum_topic[/code]
* [code]forum_post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the antecedent name or consequent name fields.
* [code]status[/code] - Case-insensitive search on the status field.
* [code]category[/code] - Searches on the category of the consequent tag, with support for multiple categories being space-delimited.
* [code]implied_from[/code] - List of tag implication ancestors of the antecedent tag.
* [code]implied_to[/code] - List of tag implication descendants of the consequent tag.

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by created_at descending.
* [code]updated_at[/code] - Orders by updated_at descending.
* [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]tag_count[/code] - Orders by post count of the consequent tag, then alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]custom[/code] - See "here":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order] for more info.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_implications/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_implications/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.
Restricted to Admin+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/tag_implications_controller.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag_relationship.rb>
<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag_implication.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/tag_implication_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table

title: api:artist_commentaries
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create or update":#dtext-create-or-update
* 07. "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 08. "See also":#dtext-see-also
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the artist commentary records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]original_title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]original_description[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]translated_title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]translated_description[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Post that the artist commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "artist_commentaries"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "artist_commentary"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Artist commentary versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]original_title[/code]
** [code]original_description[/code]
** [code]translated_title[/code]
** [code]translated_description[/code]
* [[help:post_syntax|Post syntax]]
** [code]post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]text_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on any of the text fields.
* [code]original_present[/code] (boolean syntax) - Does it have an original title or an original description?
* [code]translated_present[/code] (boolean syntax) - Does it have a translated title or a translated description?
* [code]is_deleted[/code] (yes or no) - Does it have all empty fields or not?

h5. Search order

The search order can only be changed with the "custom parameter":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order].

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries/$id.json[/code][br][code]/posts/$post_id/artist_commentary.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist commentary ID.[br][code]$post_id[/code] is ID of the post that the commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This does a redirect to the post with that commentary when using the HTML interface.

h3#create-or-update. Create or Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries/create_or_update.json[/code][br][code]/posts/$post_id/artist_commentary/create_or_update.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$post_id[/code] is ID of the post that the commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Create/update parameters]]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]post_id[/code] - The post ID the commentary belongs to.
*** When using the [code]/posts/$post_id/[/code] version, the post ID is already set.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]original_title[/code]
** [code]original_description[/code]
** [code]translated_title[/code]
** [code]translated_description[/code]
** [code]add_commentary_tag[/code] - Add the [[commentary]] tag.
** [code]add_commentary_request_tag[/code] - Add the [[commentary_request]] tag.
** [code]add_commentary_check_tag[/code] - Add the [[commentary_check]] tag.
** [code]add_partial_commentary_tag[/code] - Add the [[partial_commentary]] tag.
** [code]remove_commentary_tag[/code] - Remove the [[commentary]] tag.
** [code]remove_commentary_request_tag[/code] - Remove the [[commentary_request]] tag.
** [code]remove_commentary_check_tag[/code] - Remove the [[commentary_check]] tag.
** [code]remove_partial_commentary_tag[/code] - Remove the [[partial_commentary]] tag.

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries/$id/revert.json[/code][br][code]/posts/$post_id/artist_commentary/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the post ID (not the artist commentary ID).[br][code]$post_id[/code] is ID of the post that the commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The artist commentary version ID to revert to.

[tn][b]Note:[/b] The version ID may be passed along as a URL parameter instead of in the body.[/tn]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/artist_commentaries_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/artist_commentary.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/artist_commentary_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: moonlight_flower
body:
A relatively low-level boss in [[Ragnarok Online]]. She is a [[fox girl|fox]] demon who wields a large enchanted [[bell]] on a [[holding staff|staff]]. Her arena is located on the fifth floor of Payon dungeon. Her sprite is somewhat infamous for running around [[bottomless]], although later revisions have her with a [[criss-cross halter]] [[yellow bra]] and [[yellow panties]]. Whether or not she has a [[fox tail|tail]] is ambiguous, but most artists draw with her a [[fox hat]] and [[animal hands|animal]] [[animal feet|limbs]].

h4. See also

* [[Cat o' Nine Tails (Ragnarok Online)|]]: A similar miniboss who wears blue (and panties).
* [[Nine tail (ragnarok online)|]]: Her [[kitsune]] [[fox]]es that she summons

h4. External links

* "Ragnarok Wiki: Moonlight Flower":[https://ragnarok.fandom.com/wiki/Moonlight_Flower]

title: kagenarumono
body: [b]Kagenarumono[/b], often shortened to [b]Kage[/b], is a character in [[Street Fighter V]]. He is the Satsui no Hadou within [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] after being purged from his body. Essentially the [[Evil Ryu]] persona manifesting its own body, he appears as a [[doppelganger]] of Ryu, albeit with certain traits of [[Akuma (street fighter)|]] ([[dark skin]] and a [[kanji]] on his back) and his [[Kuruoshiki Oni|Oni]] form ([[demon horns]] and [[tusks]]).

title: help:api_read_requests
body:
These are API requests which use the HTTP GET or POST methods.

h4. Limit

Read requests are unlimited for all user levels.

h4. URL parameters

When doing a read through a GET request, the parameters must be passed in through the URL, and must use URL hash encoding ([[Help:Hash syntax]]).

h4. Body parameters

When doing a read through a POST request, the parameters must be passed in through the body. See the method override below for more information "[1]":[#dtext-method-override].

h5. URL encoding

These parameters use URL hash encoding ([[Help:Hash syntax]]).

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/x-www-form-urlencoded[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] PARAMETER=VALUE
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]search[name]=test&limit=20_method=get[/code]

h5. JSON encoding

These parameters use JSON hash encoding "[2]":[#dtext-external-links].

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/json[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] { "OBJECT": { "PARAMETER": VALUE } }
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]{ "search": { "name": "test" }, "limit": 20}[/code]

h4#method-override. Using POST for GET override

The POST method can be used to send data to endpoints that require the GET method, in such cases where the parameters must be sent in the body, such as the URL limit being exceeded.

h5. URL encoding

Set the parameter [code]_method[/code] with the value "get".

h5. JSON encoding

Set the [code]X-HTTP-Method-Override[/code] header with value "get".

h4. See also

* [[Help:API write requests]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[1] https://www.w3resource.com/JSON/structures.php

title: help:api_write_requests
body:
These are API requests which use the HTTP POST, PUT/PATCH or DELETE methods.

h4. Limit

These types of requests are rate-limited per user level ([[Help:Users]]). Burst writes is just where the available API writes caps off at. Regen rate is just how quickly the available writes get replaced after use.

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Member levels[/th]
[th]Burst writes[/th]
[th]Regen rate[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]Member[/td]
[td]10 API writes[/td]
[td]1 write/sec[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Gold[/td]
[td]30 API writes[/td]
[td]2 write/sec[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Platinum+[/td]
[td]60 API writes[/td]
[td]4 write/sec[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4. Parameters

The parameters for write requests must be passed along in the body instead of as part of the URL.

h5. URL encoding

These parameters use URL hash encoding ([[Help:Hash syntax]]), where the base object is the singular name of the endpoint.

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/x-www-form-urlencoded[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] OBJECT[PARAMETER]=VALUE
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]post[rating]=s&post[tag_string]=danboo[/code]

h5. JSON encoding

These parameters use JSON hash encoding "[1]":[#dtext-external-links], where the base object is also the singular name of the endpoint.

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/json[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] { "OBJECT": { "PARAMETER": VALUE } }
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]{ "post": { "rating": "s", "tag_string": "danboo" } }[/code]

h4. Using POST for method override

The POST method can be used to send data to endpoints that require other methods, in such cases where only one method is available, for instance [code]<form>[/code] HTML elements.

h5. URL encoding

PUT/PATCH and DELETE methods can also be sent by setting the parameter [code]_method[/code] with the name of the method as its value.

h5. JSON encoding

PUT/PATCH and DELETE methods can also be sent by setting the [code]X-HTTP-Method-Override[/code] header with the name of the method as its value.

h4. See also

* [[Help:API read requests]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[1] https://www.w3resource.com/JSON/structures.php

title: turn_a_gundam
body:
[i][b]Turn A Gundam[/b][/i] (stylized as [b]∀ Gundam[/b]) is a 1999 anime series written and directed by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] for the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]] series, marking his return to Sunrise after [[v_gundam|V Gundam]] in 1993.

Thousands of years into the future and in the aftermath of an ancient apocalyptic war, the "Earthrace" reverted to a Victorian-era lifestyle, while the more technologically advanced "Moonrace" went into cryostasis, waiting for the day they could repopulate the Earth, while occasionally sending advance scout parties to mingle with and spy on the Earthrace.

However, one such scout, [[Loran Cehack]], has since grew fond of the Earthrace, and when a Moonrace immigrant party began to stir trouble, Loran piloted the Turn A, a mobile suit worshipped as the "White Idol" by his adoptive nation, to not only prevent further conflict, but also bring peace between both races.

The series is notable because the peculiar looking hero [[mobile suit]] from the show and many other [[robot]]s were designed by an [[united_states|American]] artist ([[Syd Mead]]).

h4.See also

* [[Turn A Gundam (Mobile Suit)]]
* [[Turn X]]

* [[Orguss 02]] a 1993 mecha OVA with similar premise and [[steampunk]] setting.

title: orguss_02
body:
[b][i]Orguss 02[/i][/b] (オーガス 02, [i]Ōgasu Zero Tsū[/i]) is a 6 episode anime OVA released in Japan during 1993 and sequel to [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss|the original Orguss TV series]]. It is part of the [[Orguss]] franchise and has a peculiar [[steampunk]] setting. 

The OVA was later released on DVD in the US and UK by Manga Entertainment in the mid 90s.

h4. Related characters
* [[Nataruma]]
* [[Riin (Orguss 02)]]
* [[Toria (Orguss 02)]]
* [[Mannings]]
[spoilers]* [[Taii]][/spoilers]

h4. Related mecha
* [[Orguss 02 (mecha)]]

h4. See also
* [[Turn A Gundam]] - a mecha anime with similar premise and steampunk setting.

title: henken_bekkener
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] series from 1985.

[b]Henken Bekkener[/b] is a war veteran who was an [[Earth Federation]] [[Salamis Class]] battleship officer during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. 

Years later he became a capable and [[serious]] [[AEUG]] battleship captain. Henken was the first captain of the AEUG flagship, [i]The [[Argama]][/i] and later transfered his command to [i]The Radish[/i]. 

[spoiler]He dies at the final [[battle]] of The Gryps War after the bridge of his ship is attacked by [[Yazan Gable]] in his [[Hambrabi]], as Henken is desperately trying to give support fire to [[Emma Sheen]]'s [[Gundam Mk II]].[/spoiler]
other_names: ヘンケン・ベッケナー

title: matsuno_karamatsu
body:
[quote]
For a type of [[tree]] called kara-matsu in Japanese, use [[larch]].
[/quote]

A character from [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i] and its spin-offs. The second born son of the Matsuno family, he is characterized by his tidiness and fickle personality. In [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i], he is the most vain of the brothers and constantly tries to act cool, but with very little success. 

In the original series, he looks and acts identically to his brothers, but he is easily told apart by his large eyebrows and proud attitude in the sequel. He is also associated with the color blue.

title: mini_person
body:
A person that is extraordinarily small in size compared to their surroundings. Their small stature could be established against a humongous environment, or with normal sized characters.

If you can distinguish the gender of the small person, tag them as [[minigirl]] or [[miniboy]].

Non-living [[doll]]s aren't considered minipeople.

For a ordinary sized character and a miniperson in the same image, use [[size difference]]. If the larger character is holding the miniperson, use [[holding mini person]] or [[in palm]].

h4. See also

* [[chibi]]
* [[giant]]
* [[minigirl]]
* [[miniboy]]
* [[undersized animal]]

For miniature non-human characters like creatures and animals, see [[undersized animal]].

title: minigirl
body:
A girl that is extraordinarily small in size compared to her surroundings. Her small stature could be established against a humongous environment, or with normal sized characters.

Girls who are small but not extraordinarily or unnaturally so are [[petite]] instead. Non-living [[doll]]s are not considered minigirls.

For the male counterpart to this tag, see [[miniboy]]. For non-humanoid characters like creatures and animals, see [[undersized animal]].

title: highway
body:
A paved [[road]], typically [[multi-lane road|multi-lane]], designed for high-speed or long distance [[motor vehicle]] traffic, often between cities.  They're main public roads serving as high-speed thoroughfares.

The difference between a highway and a [[street]] is that a street is usually inside a [[city]] and designed for both vehicle and pedestrian traffic, with [[traffic light]]s, [[sidewalk]]s, and [[crosswalk]]s, while a [[highway]] is designed only for vehicles and doesn't have these features. A street is usually designed to allow access to nearby [[building]]s, while a highway usually has limited entry and exit points.

h4. Examples

* !post #3512835
* !post #5009481

h4. Types or features

* [[divided highway]]
* [[elevated highway]]
* [[multi-lane road]]

h4. See also

* [[Autobahn]]
* [[overpass]]
* [[road]]
* [[street]]
* [[tollbooth]]
* [[traffic]]
* [[underpass]]

title: multi-lane_road
body:
A [[road]] with two or more lanes going in each direction. If in the city with sidewalks and accessible to pedestrians then also add the [[street]] tag or if it's inaccessible then add the [[highway]] tag.

This tag may also be used if there are only two or more visible lanes going in the same direction.

h4. See also

* [[Divided highway]]

Traditional lanterns use a [[candle]] or a wick dipped in oil, while modern lanterns use battery-powered lights.

For fixed [[outdoors]] lighting, use [[stone lantern]], [[wooden lantern]], or [[lamppost]] accordingly. Despite the name, the former two do not fall under this tag.

title: piano_(mega_man_megamix)
body:
Piano was a character designed by [[Ariga Hitoshi]] for the manga series [[Mega Man Megamix]]. She was meant to be a counterpart to [[Roll (mega man)|]] whose job was to control and watch over [[Bass (mega man)|]]. She has no weapons or combat ability of her own, instead having a large number of gadgets to control. She was designed to speak in a monotone, robotic voice: polite, but flat and devoid of emotion. Her purpose was to provide exposition to both the reader and the characters in the manga.

She was scrapped because Ariga felt that she would draw attention away from the stories, and there were many characters from the games that he wanted to give a deep characterization.

title: tangyuan
body:
Tangyuan is a type of boiled [[dumpling]] made from glutinous rice flour. It’s mixed with a small amount of water and shaped into round balls ([i]yuan[/i]) and cooked and in sweet or savory soup ([i]tang[/i]), then served immediately in a bowl. They come in a wide variety of colors and fillings from sugar to meat. They can also be fillingless, which are usually smaller in size. The most common, "default" one is white with sweet sesame paste.

Tangyuan are traditionally eaten during "Dongzhi festival":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dongzhi_Festival], [[Lantern Festival|Yuanxiao festival]] and served as a dessert on any occasions such as [[wedding|wedding day]], family reunion ect. In modern days they can be served as casually as an ordinary breakfast meal.

There is a technical difference between "tangyuan" and "yuanxiao". "Tangyuan" refers to the southern style, whereas "yuanxiao" refers to the northern style. The two are primarily differentiated by their method of preparation, texture and size, though they don't look that different from the outside.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tangyuan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tangyuan_(food)]
* "Wikipedia: Yuanxiao":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuanxiao]

title: lantern_festival
body:
The Lantern Festival is an event which marks the end of the [[Chinese New Year]] celebrations. It's Chinese name is Yuanxiao Festival, which refers to [[tangyuan]], the food that is eaten on the festival.

h4. See also

* [[Obon]]
* [[Sky lantern]]

title: jack-o'-lantern
body:
A vegetable [[lantern]] commonly carved from a [[pumpkin]], typically as a [[Halloween]] decoration. The pumpkin has a face or image carved into it, and the insides are usually scooped out so that a [[candle]] can be placed inside to illuminate the carving.

The practice originated from Ireland where they would use turnips or mangelwurzel to craft these lanterns for Halloween.  Irish immigrants brought this tradition to North America where it led to the development of carving pumpkins to make jack-o'-lanterns.

h4. See also

* [[unconventional jack-o'-lantern]] (made with something other than a pumpkin)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jack-o'-lantern":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack-o'-lantern]

title: two-finger_salute
body:
A gesture with the thumb, index and middle fingers extended and raised in front of the head as a form of [[salute|saluting]].

There is another gesture called "two-finger salute", which is used mostly in Britain and other countries of the British Commonwealth and is an inverted version of the v-sign with the palm of the hand facing towards the one using the gesture instead of away from him. It is considered the British (Commonwealth) version of the [[middle finger]].

Not to be confused with [[kuji-in]], various [[ninja]] gestures that may involve extending the first two fingers, but not as a salute.

h4. See also

* [[kuji-in]]
* [[salute]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: kitsune_no_mado
body:
A practice from Japanese folklore where both hands are used to create a "window" gesture, which is then [[peeking_through_fingers|peered through]] to reveal hidden spirits, often youkai disguised as humans.

The gesture starts as both hands doing [[fox shadow puppet]]s. The hands are then rotated and opened such that the fingers interlace with each other, creating the window.

h4. Examples

* !asset #24230296: "The hand gestures":https://twitter.com/gazu100youkai/status/1000334485173387264

h4. See also

* [[finger frame]]
* [[fox shadow puppet]]

h4. External links

* "The Fox Window Game":https://theghostinmymachine.com/2021/08/18/the-most-dangerous-games-the-fox-window-game-or-how-to-see-ghosts/ 
* "Twitter: The hand gestures":https://twitter.com/gazu100youkai/status/1000334485173387264

title: abhaya_mudra
body:
A [[mudra]], which is a symbolic hand gesture from Hinduism and Buddhism. 

The right hand is held upright, and the palm is [[open hand|facing outwards]].

It symbolizes reassurance and safety, intended to dispel fear and accord divine protection and bliss.

h4. Examples

* !post #1000916

title: scarlet_(black_shadow)_(nikke)
body:
Character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

[spoiler]A mass-produced Nikke from the Melee Squad. The numerous modifications she has undergone mean that her physical capabilities are far superior to those of a typical mass-produced Nikke. Known as a swordsmanship genius, possessing extraordinary skills. [/spoiler]

Similar to [[Snow White (innocent Days) (nikke)|Snow White's younger self]], this version of [[Scarlet (Nikke)|]] is during her time as part of [spoiler] the Melee squad along with her sister [[Rose (Nikke)|]] and, later on, [/spoiler] the legendary [[Goddess (Nikke)|]] squad.

She has [[red eyes]], [[grey hair|grey]] [[long hair]] and [[large breasts]]. She carries a [[sword]] on one [[holding weapon|hand]] and its [[scabbard]] in the other. She wears [[black bodysuit]], [[shoulder plates]] on her right arm, and a [[half-skirt|half ragged skirt]] that is strapped to her hip by a tight [[belt]]. She also has what appears to be a red [[halo]].
other_names: 紅蓮:ブラックシャドウ

title: sharon_carter
body: Sharon Carter (also known as Agent 13) is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by Stan Lee, Jack Kirby, and Dick Ayers, the character first appeared in Tales of Suspense #75 (March 1966). Sharon Carter is a secret agent and an ex-field agent of S.H.I.E.L.D. under [[Nick Fury]]. She is the main love interest of the superhero [[Captain America]] / [[Steve Rogers]]. Sharon Carter was originally the younger sister of [[Peggy Carter]]. She was later retconned as Peggy's grand-niece because of the unaging nature of comic book characters.

title: roboco-san
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]. A soft-spoken, high-performance [[android]]. [[Original|Originally designed]] by [[kuromaru9]] as an [[MMD]] character, but then later became a VTuber following the popularity boom of the medium.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[brown hair|brown]] [[gradient hair]] with red tips. Being an [[android]], she has [[mechanical arms]] and [[mechanical legs]]. She is extensively modular and can appear with a combination of hairstyles and [[extra ears]], along with glasses and accessories. Her breast size is [[medium breasts|medium]] in her early models, though in later model update has increased it to the [[large breasts|large]] size. By default, she has [[short hair]] and [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]].

Due to her model being originally created for the use in [[mikumikudance|MMD]], her outfit is also extremely modular. She can appear with [[long hair]] in various hairstyles; [[teardrop-framed glasses]], an [[eyepatch]] or [[no eyewear]] at all and [[cat ears]], [[rabbit ears]] or no extra ears.

In February 2023 she got an update to her model that completely redesigned her lower body, adding an extra plate on her stomach giving the impression of a [[covered navel]] and her [[mechanical legs|robot legs]] now extend all the way to her waist and cover to outer side too, giving the impression of skintight pants, she now also has humanoid feet instead of claws.

body:

It's styled after a [[black dress|black]] [[wedding dress]] and consists of a [[headpiece]] decorated with a [[head wreath|wreath]], a [[black veil|black]] [[bridal veil]] a [[long dress|long]] [[backless dress|backless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[see-through cleavage]]and [[layered dress|multiple layers]] including a [[pelvic curtain]] and a [[showgirl skirt]] with [[dress flower|flowers on the hips]], her feet are also styled after [[pumps]]. She also now has a huge metallic "tail" spike protruding from her back, and an optional [[metal collar]] and [[broken handcuffs|broken]] [[handcuffs]] which were inspired by God Eater and a [[single horn]] protruding from her right temple - a nod to Venom Snake from Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain.

title: it's_morbin'_time_(meme)
body:
Memes which reference the movie [[Morbius (film)|]], typically quoting either the famous catchphrase of the protagonist [[Morbius]] (played elegantly by [[Jared Leto]]): "It's Morbin' time", or the oft-quoted line from [spoilers]his final battle with the Anti-Morb[/spoilers]: "I am beginning to Morb..."

[spoilers]All of the quotes this meme revolves around are never actually said in the movie and are purely memetic, being fabricated to mock the actual movie, which is overwhelmingly panned by critics.[/spoilers]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/its-morbin-time

title: star_wars:_rebels
body:
[b][i]Star Wars: Rebels[/i][/b] is an American [[3D]] CGI animated television series produced by Lucasfilm Animation and released in 2014.  It is a sequel to [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]].

It premiered as a 44-minute film, [i]Star Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion[/i], on October 3, 2014 on Disney Channel prior to the official premiere of the series on October 13 on Disney XD. So far 2 seasons have been released in 2014 and 2015, with a third season coming in September 24, 2016.

The show is set 14 years after [i]Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith[/i] and five years before [i]Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope[/i]. 

[i]Rebels[/i] takes place during an era when the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] is securing its grip on the galaxy. Imperial forces are hunting down the last of the [[Jedi]] Knights while a fledgling [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] against the Empire is taking form. 

Most of the visual style of Star Wars Rebels is notable because it is inspired by the [[Star Wars]] original trilogy concept art by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie .

A Japanese webcomic adapting the series began publication in 2019. The adaptation features art by [[Aoki Akira]] and is published by [[Line (naver)|]] in Japan, while physical volumes are translated and published overseas by Yen Press.

h4. See also

* [[Ezra Bridger]]
* [[Kanan Jarrus]]
* [[Hera Syndulla]]
* [[Sabine Wren]]
* [[Zeb Orrelios]]
* [[ghost_(spaceship)|Ghost]]

title: time_crisis_(series)
body:
A arcade light gun shooter series by [[Namco]]. A common theme with each entry of the game is the fictional intelligence agency VSSE (Vital Situation, Swift-Elimination) whose agents are protagonists in each game and the mercenary terrorist, Wild Dog, who serves as a recurring enemy boss in each game.

Since 2015, there have been five Time Crisis games, and three spin-off games.

A [[rabbit girl | cautus girl]] from Rim Billiton, has no stable job and is often engaged in mine security work as what is called a "well explorer" in Rim Billiton. After encountering [[Amiya (Arknights)|]], [[Doctor (Arknights)|]], and [[Savage (arknights)|]] who were returning to their hometown by chance, she took the initiative to apply to join Rhode Island. Now as a Rhode Island operator, she participates in various security, combat, and exploration missions.

Her design resembles [[Makise Kurisu]] from [[Steins;Gate]]

Her [[voice actor|voice actress]] is [[Nazuka Kaori]].

The youngest member of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A6. She was left by her parents in a lumberyard after contracting Oripathy, but was later rescued by [[Ansel (arknights)|]] and [[Kal'tsit (arknights)|]].

She possesses a tremendous strenght and has a tendency to experience violent attacks, of which she has no recollection after the fact. Her infected eye also contains an unknown power, that must be kept hidden by the [[eyepatch]].

Her motif is based on the lop-eared [[rabbit]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are Ousaki Chiyo (Japanese), Chen Yanyi (Chinese), Kayli Mills (English) and Ryu Jeom-hee (Korean). Her original art designer is [[Xiayehongming]], while her new outfit is drawn by [[3MO]].

Vanilla is a [[blacksteel worldwide (arknights)|Blacksteel]] trainee, currently training and studying as part of exchange program with Rhodes Island. She has learned to use her race's combat abilities to her advantage, and performs well as a Vanguard.

She keeps pets in the base, most notably [[originium slug (arknights)|originium slugs]], as shown in her story segment during the [i]Stories of Afternoon[/i] event.

Uses a [[halberd|hellebarde]] as her weapon of choice.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Sugiura Shiori (Japanese), Ruoyu Zhang (Chinese), Stephanie Sheh (English), and Kang Sae-bom (Korean). Her original art designer is [[heibaise jiangshi]], while her outfit is drawn by [[3MO]].

title: hibiki_dan
body:
[i]I hate the [[Ryuuko no Ken|art of fighting]], but I wanna be [[the king of fighters]]![/i]
--Dan Hibiki, [[street fighter zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]]

[b]Dan Hibiki[/b], known simply as [b]Dan[/b], is a character from [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter]] franchise who first debuted in [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]. Dan is consistently portrayed as an arrogant, overconfident, yet utterly weak character in many of the games he is featured in. He is widely considered to be the comic relief of the series because of his over-the-top poses and battle cries.

He is originally created as a jab on [[SNK]]'s [[Ryuuko no Ken]] characters [[Ryou Sakazaki]] and [[Robert Garcia]], whom Capcom viewed as a rip-off of [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] and [[Ken masters|Ken]] respectively. Notably featuring numerous taunts from SNK's own fighting game franchise [[The King of Fighters]].

A (self-proclaimed) [[Hong Kong]]er martial artist of Japanese origin. Dan's father, [[Hibiki Gou]], was a rival of [[Sagat]]. Gou gouged out Sagat's right eye and Sagat beat him to death in retaliation. Because of this, Dan sought revenge on Sagat, training to become a fighter, but was expelled from [[Gouken]]'s dojo when his motivations were learned. Dan thus developed his own style of Gouken's martial art merged with Muay Thai elements and called it Saikyo-ryu, "The Strongest Style", despite the complete weakness of his techniques.

Unlike the rest of the Street Fighter cast Dan can taunt while crouching or jumping. He even has a "super taunt" that uses up his entire super meter to perform the greatest and flashiest taunt in the world.

title: hibiki_gou
body: A non-playable character in the [[Street Fighter]] series and the late father of [[Hibiki Dan]] and [[Hibiki Yuriko]].

title: hibiki_yuriko
body: A character from Capcom's [[Street Fighter]] series. She is the younger sister of [[Hibiki Dan]], first appearing in his ending in [[Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter]] in a sequence that parodies [[Ryou Sakazaki]]'s ending in the first [[Ryuuko no Ken]]. She later returned in [[Street Fighter V]] and [[Street Fighter 6]] as a shopkeeper in the Shop menu and the Battle Hub respectively.

title: the_legend_of_zelda:_twilight_princess
body:
[i]The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess[/i] is the thirteenth installment in the [[The Legend of Zelda]] series, developed by [[Nintendo]] for the [[Wii]] (see [[Wii Version]]) and [[GameCube]].

The story focuses on [[Link]], who tries to prevent Hyrule from being engulfed by the Twilight Realm. To do so, he takes the form of both a Hylian and a [[Wolf link|wolf]], and is assisted by a mysterious creature named [[Midna]]. The game takes place hundreds of years after [[the_legend_of_zelda:_ocarina_of_time|Ocarina of Time]] and [[the_legend_of_zelda:_majora's_mask|Majora's Mask]], in an alternate timeline from [[the_legend_of_zelda:_the_wind_waker|The Wind Waker]].

title: apron
body:
An apron is an outer protective garment that covers primarily the front of the body.  It may be worn for hygienic reasons as well as in order to protect clothes from wear and tear. The apron is commonly part of the uniform of several work categories, including waitresses, nurses, and maids.  It is also worn as a decorative garment by women.

title: kuro_(magia_record_game)
body:
[i]Not to be confused with [[Kuro (Magia Record Anime)]] or [[Kuroe (Madoka Magica)|]].[/i]

An anonymous [[feather (magia record)|Black Feather]] from [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

Her real name is unknown, though she asked to be referred to as "匿名希望" ([i]tokumei kibou[/i], lit. "anonymous hope") in the Japanese version of the game, and as "Jane Doe" in the North American localization. Despite that, her character card calls her "黒" ([i]Kuro[/i], lit. "black").

She does not have a unique design, rather, she simply uses the regular Black Feather model with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. Whether or not any Black Feather is specifically Kuro should be determined from context, such as:
* being presented in conjunction with [[Akemi Homura]], or the holiday of Valentines,
* being presented in conjunction with her [[Witch (madoka magica)|]]/[[Doppel (Madoka magica)|]] form - [[Matasaburo (madoka magica)|]],
* being presented in conjunction with [spoilers]other dead characters, such as [[Yukino Kanae]], [[Anna Mel]] or [[Sarasa Hanna]][/spoilers],
* her name being used.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24600516

title: lance
body:
A type of [[polearm]], traditionally used by [[cavalry]] or in [[jousting]], which has a distinct and large cone for its head intended to maximize the thrusting power on impact. The cone can be as long as, or even longer, than the actual haft. Lances are a popular symbol for a [[knight]].

Not to be confused with "lances" in [[Fire Emblem]] games, which improperly use the term to refer to any kind of spear, or "[[lance (senjou no valkyria)|]]s" in [[senjou no valkyria (series)|Valkyria Chronicles]], which are a line of rocket launchers.

title: lance_(senjou_no_valkyria)
body:
A category of man-portable heavy projectile weapons used in the [[senjou no valkyria (series)|Valkyria Chronicles]] series of games.  They normally played the role as an anti-tank weapon and were designed to launch anti-tank rockets.  Mortar versions also existed for anti-infantry roles, usually visually identifiable by the grenade-like projectile they use compared to the cone-shaped rockets of the anti-tank lances.  The weapons were most commonly shaped like traditional melee [[lance]]s, especially those used by the Empire and the Principality of Gallia.  Federation lances did not share the lance-like appearance of the other game factions.

h4. Examples

* !post #1119799: Anti-tank lance 
* !post #1171475: Mortar lance

h4. See also

* [[Rocket launcher]]

title: yandere
body:
A character who alternates between a dangerously obsessive and a loving ([[deredere]]) personality.

Their affection mixes with extreme insecurities to create a type of love that is entirely insane and generally violent. The homicidal feelings differ from character to character. Some direct their attacks against the one whom they desire, while others direct it against anyone who gets too close to the person they love.

This tag is for characters displaying this personality trait through their words or actions. Do not use it simply because the character is canonically yandere.

h4. Examples

* !post #2426144
* !post #5958139

h4. Notable characters

* [[Gasai Yuno]] from [[Mirai Nikki]], an example of aggression against anyone getting too close to her love interest.
* [[Katsura Kotonoha]] from [[School Days]], an example of aggression towards a love interest.
* [[Yamagishi Yukako]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], a character that is often described as the progenitor of the archetype. 

h4. See also

* [[nata (tool)|]]
* [[tsundere]]
* [[yandere trance]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Obsessive love disorder":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obsessive_love_disorder
* "TVTropes: Yandere":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Yandere

body:

Not to be confused with holding a [[nata (tool)|]], the weapon wielded by [[yandere]]s.

title: nata_(tool)
body:
A usually double-handed striking tool with a sharp rectangular blade used to cut and split wood. It resembles an oversized [[cleaver]].

It also is an archetypical [[yandere]] weapon.

h4.See also

* [[hashitsuki nata]]
* [[hatchet (axe)]]
* [[cleaver]]
* [[list of weapons]]

title: cleaver
body:
A single-handed butcher's [[knife]] with a square blade resembling a small [[nata (tool)|]]. 

Cleavers come in two sizes, small and full size. Small cleavers are generally for home use, they are 180-210mm (7-8inch) in length. Full size cleavers are for professional/restaurant use, they are 220-250mm (9-10 inch). 

If the blade is bigger and/or it's double-handed it's a [[nata (tool)|]], a common weapon for a [[yandere]]. 

h4. See also 

* [[nata (tool)|]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: witch_(madoka_magica)
body:
Entities from the series [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]], said to manifest due to negative emotions and actions in the world ([spoiler]specifically from magical girls[/spoiler]). Upon targeting their victims they leave a mark called a Witch's Kiss (魔女の口づけ). To conceal themselves the witches create [[witch's_labyrinth|barriers]].

Each witch appears to be accompanied by a [[familiar (Madoka Magica)|]] (使い魔).

title: school_uniform
body:
A uniform commonly worn by students of various grades depending on the country; in Japan, they're mostly worn by middle school and high school students. The two most common designs are the [[serafuku]] and [[blazer]].

Common accessories can include: [[sweater]], [[cardigan]], [[sweater vest]], [[thighhighs]], and [[kneehighs]]. A [[gakuran]] is a popular uniform worn by boys. A common footwear for both genders while in school is the [[uwabaki]].

All {{*_school_uniform}} tags automatically add the [[school uniform]] tag.

title: dark_matter_(kirby)
body:
A recurring boss and villain in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series who posesses others, most notably [[King Dedede]]. It is one of the ultimate villains of the series and the second one to appear after [[Nightmare_(kirby)|]].

Its motives are unclear, but there are theories that Dark Matter lived a lonely existence in the galaxy and decided, "If I cannot be happy, no one can." So it made several attempts to dominate the universe by spreading its dark influence in the form of dark clouds all over planets that take control of the minds of whoever they possess.

Dark Matter is controlled by [[Zero_(kirby)|]], the second resident universal dominator and ultimate evil in Kirby's universe after Nightmare.

h4. Appearance

body: Use [[holding sword]] + [[shinai]].

title: shinai
body:
A [[kendo]] practice [[sword]] made of [[bamboo]] strips. 

It is the standard wooden training [[weapon]] for sparring and formal competitions in kendo, as it is unlikely to injure the competitors (especially with the padded armor required in kendo tournaments).

h4. See also

* [[bokken]]
* [[sword]]
* [[weapon bag]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: bokken
body:
A lethal [[kendo]] practice [[sword]] made of solid, heavy wood. It's shaped and balanced like a [[katana]]. 

Bokken are normally used for solo training, not for sparring. For that, the [[shinai]] is used, as sparring with a bokken will usually lead to broken bones... or worse. 

Legendary [[samurai]] swordmaster [[Miyamoto Musashi]] is said to have fought and killed [[katana]]-wielding rival samurai by using just a bokken against them.

h4. See also

* [[shinai]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: glaive_(polearm)
body:
A glaive is a European [[polearm]] weapon, consisting of a single-edged blade on the end of a pole. It is similar to the Japanese [[naginata]] and the Chinese [[guan dao]].

The term "glaive" has also been repurposed in certain (primarily Western) fantasy series to describe an oversized throwing weapon resembling a [[shuriken]], [[chakram]] or [[throwing knife]]. [b]Do not[/b] tag these examples as glaive; use the appropriate tags instead.

h4. Notable characters
* [[Tatsuta_(kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
* [[Hellion (darkest_dungeon)|]] ([[Darkest Dungeon]]) 
* [[Sailor Saturn]] ([[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]])
** Her Silence Glaive is technically a glaive[i]-fork[/i], but we currently don't distinguish. [tn]And we probably shouldn't.[/tn]


h4. Tag usage notes
* Tag glaive when you see the polearm weapon described above.
* Avoid tagging glaive when the weapon can be more appropriately described with another polearm tag.
** e.g. [[naginata]], [[nagimaki]], [[guan dao]], [[scythe]], [[halberd]], [[bardiche]], [[billhook]]
* [b]Do not[/b] tag throwing weapons with glaive.
** Even if they are called "glaive" in the series. Use the appropriate throwing weapon tag instead.
** Unless some crazy person decides to use actual polearm glaives as 'throwing weapons'.


h4. See also

* [[Naginata]]
* [[Nagimaki]]
* [[Guan dao]]
* [[Scythe]]
* [[Halberd]]
* [[Bardiche]]
* [[Billhook]]
* [[Double blade]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Glaive":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glaive]

body: An [[energy sword]]/[[double blade]] from the [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] universe, it is the kind of [[lightsaber]] [[Darth Maul]] used. Originally created by the [[Sith]], [[Jedi]] have also used such weapons. [[Bastila Shan]] and [[Satele Shan]] are notable example of such.

title: lady_maria_of_the_astral_clocktower
body:
Character from From Software's [[Bloodborne]].

Lady Maria is a renowned Huntress who comes from Cainhurst, and is related to Queen Annalise of the Vilebloods. She was trained under the tutelage of [[gehrman_the_first_hunter|Gehrman]].

Despite being of Cainhurst descent, she refused to use either blood magic or the Chikage; Instead, her trick weapon of choice is the [[Rakuyo_(bloodborne)|Rakuyo]], a [[double blade|Two-edged sword]] which can be separated.

[spoiler]She has an extreme resemblance to [[plain_doll|The Plain Doll]]. This is because Gehrman, who had a secret infatuation with Maria whilst training her, modeled the Doll after her.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After being trapped within the Hunter's Nightmare, she sought to defend the Fishing Hamlet that was ravaged by Byrgenweth from anyone aiming to get into it. As such, she serves as the penultimate plot-mandated boss of the DLC.[/spoiler]

title: heavy_spear_(evangelion)
body: A massive [[double blade]]s used by [[Mass Production Eva]]ngelions against [[Eva 02|Unit-02]] in [[The End of Evangelion]]. [spoilers]They are actually masked replicas of the [[Lance of Longinus (Evangelion)|]] and are able to transform to their original [[bident]] form (but grey instead of red).[/spoilers]

title: bardiche_(riot_blade_ii)_(nanoha)
body:
[[Bardiche (nanoha)|]]'s upgraded default melee form in [[Mahou Senki Lyrical Nanoha Force]].

Takes the base appearance of an [[energy sword]]. This sword has a more ornate axe-shaped hilt and curvier blade compared to those on the older [[Bardiche (riot blade) (nanoha)|Riot Blade]] and Riot Zanber forms.

The Riot Blade II can appear as:
* A single energy sword, like the older [[Bardiche (riot blade) (nanoha)|Riot Blade]] form.
* Twin energy swords, like [[Bardiche (riot zanber stinger) (nanoha)|Riot Zanber Stinger]]. Unlike Riot Zanber Stinger this form does not have the "mana string" connecting both pommels.
* Two energy swords fused hilt-to-hilt into a single [[double blade|double-ended 'sword']].

title: xi_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It is the lead Gundam of [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

The [b]RX-105 Xi Gundam[/b] and the [[Penelope (Hathaway's Flash)|RX-104FF Penelope]] were classified as fifth-generation MS and are said to have been developed and constructed by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. It was a unique [[mobile_suit|MS]] with a built-in Minovsky Flight Unit and was equipped with the latest Beam Barrier system. Since the Penelope relied on optional units to obtain similar functions, it can be said that the Xi Gundam was a truly completed fifth-generation MS that could function independently.

Its armaments include a [[beam rifle]], a pair of [[energy sword|beam sabers]] (with a [[double blade]] function similar to the [[Nu Gundam]]'s large beam saber), a [[shield]] with a [[beam cannon]] on its tip, forearm-mounted triple missiles, and its signature [i]Funnel Missiles[/i]. True to its name, these [[funnels (gundam)|]] functions like remote controlled [[missile|missiles]], guided by the pilot's Newtype abilities and exploding upon impact. These weapons are also equipped on the Penelope.

It is piloted by [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]], [spoiler]a.k.a. [[Hathaway Noa]][/spoiler]. Designed in [[real life]] by [[Moriki Yasuhiro]] for the novel; the design was later updated by [[Fujita Kazumi]] for the [[SD Gundam G-Generation]] series; this updated design has been used in most [[video game]]s where the Xi Gundam is featured, such as Gundam Extreme Vs. and Super Robot Wars. [[Katoki Hajime]] also designed it for the FIX Figuration line as well as gave it a minor visual overhaul for the movie, featuring larger hands, a more off-white color scheme and a generally bulkier silhouette.

title: vera:_rozen_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Vera (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Rozen features [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[red hair]] past her waist, with a [[black hairband]], a black [[hair ribbon]] fitted on the back of her head, [[hair between eyes|bangs between eyes]], long [[sidelocks]], and [[red eyes]] with a single [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]].

Other apparels includes a [[ribbon]] on the chin, [[white bodysuit]] with black [[long sleeves]], and [[spiked pauldrons]] / [[shoulder armor]]. Can be shown with or without an [[eyepatch]] on the left eye, as well as a mechanical [[headgear]] depending on awakening level.

She uses a [[katana]] / [[sword]] as weapon on her main hand, and another sword with a specialized hilt on her off hand, the two can combine and form a [[double blade]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])

* [[vera: rozen (agony break) (pgr)|Agony Break]]

title: grabbing_own_breast
body:

Not be confused with:

* [[breast lift]] (when the breasts are lifted up by the hands)
* [[breast suppress]] (when the hands are resting on top of the breasts)

* [[covering breasts]] (when the [[nipples]] are covered with the hands, without lifting the breast)

title: hatsune_miku_x_kodo
body:
A series of live concerts featuring a collaboration between Crypton Future Media and the Japanese drumming group [b]Kodo, Taiko Performing Arts Ensemble[/b].

The performance included various [[Vocaloid]] songs featuring [[Hatsune Miku]], [[Kagamine Rin]]/[[kagamine len|Len]], and [[Megurine Luka]] playing alongside the drummers. The first concert took place in 2017, a sequel in 2018, and the final concert (also including [[MEIKO (Vocaloid)|]] and [[KAITO (Vocaloid)|]]) in 2023.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid Games and Events]]

h4. External links

* "Event homepage":[https://kodo-miku.com/]
* "Kodo Website":https://www.kodo.or.jp/en/

title: daihatsu_move_canbus
body:
The [b]Daihatsu Move Canbus[/b] is a van-style [i]kei[/i] car manufactured by Japanese automobile manufacturer Daihatsu starting in 2016. Despite its name, it is not based on the same platform as the regular Daihatsu Move (which is a more conventionally styled [i]kei[/i] car). As of model year 2022, the Move Canbus is in its second generation. The first-generation model is particularly notable for the [[Hatsune Miku]] edition, which was a special [[Vocaloid]]-themed deco package offered in collaboration with Crypton Future Media for the 2017 model year.

According to Daihatsu, the name "Canbus" is a portmanteau of "can", meant to imply that the car is capable, and "bus" from its [[Volkswagen Type 2]]-inspired body styling.
